Tornadus can also help to stop other weather teams from outdamaging Kyogre while letting Kyogre deal with opposing weather attackers. Tornadus benefits other Pokemon with its weather as well such as Urshifu-R, Koraidon and Archaludon. It can also provide a check to weather-setting Pokemon like Koraidon and Groudon with opposing weather. Checks to Tornadus include Miraidon and Raging Bolt. Their ability to resist its attacks and fire back with powerful Electric-type STAB moves can threaten both Tornadus and its common partners. One other check is Kingambit. Often, Tornadus cannot attack with Bleakwind Storm due to the threat of Defiant being activated. It can easily set up in front of Tornadus or, if it has Assault Vest, threaten its partner. Landorus, however, can help to beat some of these checks with strong Sandsear Storms in Rain while being immune to Miraidon's and Raging Bolt's Electric-type STAB moves. Trick Room teams are also a bad matchup, as they flip the Speed stats and make Tailwind useless. Calyrex-I is especially tough for Tornadus, as it can target it down with strong Glacial Lances or set Trick Room right in front of it.

Bulky Tailwind.description:
• Bleakwind Storm provides good damage into Rillaboom and Ogerpon-W. Tailwind is the most effective speed control Tornadus has access to. Taunt helps shut down Amoonguss and helps to manage certain Trick Room Pokemon like Porygon2 and Dusclops, but Protect can be run instead to ensure Tailwind goes up. Rain Dance and Sunny Day serve as weather control, which enables your sweepers and disables opposing weather-based sweepers. Rain Dance pairs well with Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W while Sunny Day powers up Chi-Yu and Flutter Mane.

  • This given EV spread focuses on bulk, surviving Mystic Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and Tera Fairy Choice Specs Moonblast from Flutter Mane. The low Speed investment ensures that Tornadus sets up its own weather.

  • Rocky Helmet helps against Urshifu-R mirrors and provides good chip into opposing physical attackers making contact. Covert Cloak prevents Fake Out flinches from Incineroar and Rillaboom. It also negates any secondary effects from moves like Rock Slide and Icy Wind. This ensures that Tailwind goes up. Mental Herb helps to shrug off one Taunt.

  • Tera Dark provides an immunity to Prankster Taunt, guaranteeing Tailwind. Tera Steel provides useful resistance to Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane's STAB moves. Both Tera types improve matchups into Psyspam and against Electric-type moves from Pokemon like Raging Bolt, Iron Hands and Archaludon.

Offensive Tailwind.description:
• Focus Sash ensures Tornadus survives one attack and set up Tailwind. Protect becomes important to avoid Fake Out without committing the Tera early.

  • Tornadus rarely Terastallizes, but Tera Ghost can ensure that it can more reliably set up Tailwind by negating Fake Out from Pokemon like Incineroar and Rillaboom, and Extreme Speed from Pokemon like Dragonite and Entei. Tera Flying increases its offensive pressure.

Life Orb.description:
Landorus is one of the strongest Pokemon in the metagame thanks to its access to strong Ground-type STAB moves in Earth Power and Sandsear Storm, which are further boosted by its ability, Sheer Force. In conjunction with Life Orb, Landorus can OHKO top metagame Pokemon like Incineroar, Zacian-C and Kingambit. Sludge Bomb allows Landorus to OHKO Ogerpon-H while threatening huge damage to Assault Vest Rillaboom and Ogerpon-W. Substitute allows Landorus to stay on the field longer and avoid Amoonguss's Spore, which allows it to deal continuous damage. Tera Poison allows Landorus to OHKO Ogerpon-W with Sludge Bomb, while shedding weaknesses to common attacks like Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and Ice Spinner from Chien-Pao; it also allows Landorus to deal great damage to common Tera Fairy users, like Raging Bolt and Flutter Mane. Tera Steel allows Landorus to resist Ice while also giving a neutrality against Water-type STAB moves from common Pokemon like Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W. The EV spread allows it to survive Tera Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R while Terastallized and Moonblast from Choice Specs Flutter Mane. The investment in Special Attack allows it to OHKO uninvested Urshifu-R safely.

Landorus has a poor matchup against Chien-Pao, Calyrex-I, and Kyogre, which can all OHKO Landorus. It also struggles against Tailwind teams, which can remove it before it can deal significant damage. Once Terastallized, Ogerpon-W threatens huge damage on Landorus, while also taking reduced damage from Sludge Bomb. Kyogre sets up rain with Drizzle, allowing Landorus to spam Life-Orb boosted Sandsear Storm without any accuracy drawbacks. Tornadus sets up Tailwind, letting Landorus move before non-Tailwind teams. In return, Landorus threatens Raging Bolt, which generally threatens both Tornadus and Kyogre.

Landorus-Therian.overview:
• A great STAB combination, a sky-high Attack stat, and Intimidate allow Landorus-T to function well in many different roles. These make it a great Choice Band sweeper, threatening many common metagame threats such as Raging Bolt and Flutter Mane. Landorus-T can also function as a Intimidate pivoter, using its great STAB combination and movepool to provide utility.

  • More offensive Landorus-T sets appreciate speed control support from Tornadus and Icy Wind Flutter Mane, with the former being more consistent by providing Tailwind support and hitting the Grass-types that resist Ground such as Rillaboom, while the latter has excellent offensive synergy. Redirection support from Ogerpon-W and Amoonguss is also appreciated, with both benefiting from Intimidate and Ogerpon-W specifically handling the Ice- and Water-types that give Landorus-T trouble. Choice Scarf Landorus-T partners well with all of the above options; however, it doesn't rely on speed control compared to Choice Band variants.

  • Rillaboom and Ogerpon-W are difficult for Landorus-T to handle, with the former having Fake Out. which is even more potent because Landorus-T almost exclusively runs Choice items, and halving the damage of Earthquake, while the latter has super effective Water-type STAB moves and a way to redirect its Stomping Tantrum; both of these also resist Ground. Incineroar is also an issue, as even though it's weak to Ground, Intimidate and Parting Shot let it constantly debuff Landorus-T, removing the its potential to OHKO many Pokemon. Landorus-T also finds itself difficult to slot into many teams, as each of its individual strong points are better found in other options, such as Incineroar generally being a strong Intimidate pivot and the other Landorus forme being a better offensive threat.

Offensive Sweeper.description:
• Stomping Tantrum is the best single target Ground-type move available, while Earthquake is used to dish out damage to more foes and bypass Follow Me. Rock Slide hits the Flying-types that are immune to Ground, while U-turn is a strong pivot option that also hits Ground-resistant Grass-types, even having a chance to OHKO frailer Ogerpon formes.

  • Choice Band allows Landorus-T to function as a sweeper, partially negating the low Base Power of its Ground-type moves and giving it rolls to OHKO many prevalent threats such as Raging Bolt, Kingambit, and Flutter Mane.

  • The Defense investment allows Landorus-T to survive a Wicked Blow from Tera Dark Urshifu-S, Kowtow Cleave from a +1 Attack Black Glasses Kingambit, and Ivy Cudgel from Ogerpon-W. The Special Defense investment allows Landorus-T to survive a Moonblast from Choice Specs Flutter Mane. The Speed investment outspeeds Adamant Chien-Pao at -1, with the rest being put into Attack.

  • Tera Fairy is generally preferred for being a stronger neutral type into the current metagame. It also resists Sucker Punch from Kingambit, which threatens big damage thanks to its ability Defiant, and other Dark-type attackers, allowing it to wall Urshifu-S.

Damage Oriented Pivot.description:
• Stomping Tantrum is used as the strongest Ground-type move available, with Rock Slide being coverage for Flying-types and U-turn for general utility. Tera Blast Flying gives Landorus-T a Flying-type move, despite coming at a high cost, allowing it to hit the Grass-types that otherwise resist Stomping Tantrum, as well as generally having more flexibility in the matchups it can be brought to.

  • Choice Scarf gives Landorus-T the jump on many of its counters such as Chien-Pao and Ogerpon-W and helps it pivot more easily with U-turn.

  • The EV spread still survives Wicked Blow from Tera Dark Urshifu-S and Ivy Cudgel from Ogerpon-W, with the Attack investment guaranteeing an OHKO on Rillaboom with Tera Blast Flying.

  • Tera Flying is used to give Landorus-T a Flying-type STAB move with Tera Blast and remove its Water-type weakness.

Sylveon.overview:
• Sylveon's solid natural bulk as well as access to absurd damage from Pixilate-boosted Hyper Voice makes it a solid setup sweeper. With its pure Fairy typing, Sylveon boasts a better matchup into Ghost- and Dark-type threats such as Flutter Mane and Urshifu-S than its main Fairy-type competition, Flutter Mane.

  • Sylveon appreciates support from Fake Out and Follow Me, allowing it to set up Throat Spray or Calm Mind more easily. Incineroar makes up for Sylveons middling physical bulk with Parting Shot and Intimidate, as well as handling the Steel- and Fire-types that Sylveon struggles against. Ogerpon-W not only provides Follow Me support but similarly to Incineroar is able to handle Steel- and Fire-type attacks safely. Landorus is a great offensive partner, with it and Sylveon covering each other's checks, as well as making up for Sylveon's low initial damage output.

  • Sylveon's biggest issue is that it struggles to find a slot on most teams due to its competition with Flutter Mane, which is more of an immediate threat thanks to its higher single target damage, higher Speed, and Fake Out immunity from its Ghost typing. While Sylveon has use cases thanks to its bulk and pure Fairy typing, Flutter Mane is easier to fit into most compositions and is able to function well with minimal support. Sylveon's middling Speed means it is vulnerable to being overwhelmed by foes, making utilizing its strong setup options difficult.

Throat Spray Sweeper.description:
• Hyper Voice allows Sylveon to utilize Throat Spray as well as being a strong spread move after the boost from Pixilate. Misty Terrain allows Sylveon to block Spore from Amoonguss, while Calm Mind is also viable as another way to further increase Sylveon‘s damage output. Quick Attack picks off Urshifu-S and Chien-Pao, which normally run Focus Sash. If Sylveon is running Tera Fire, Tera Blast is also an option to hit Fairy-resistant foes such as Amoonguss and Gholdengo, as well as being a strong single target Fairy-type move before Terastallization thanks to Pixilate.

  • The invested Defense allows Sylveon to survive Wood Hammer from Rillaboom, as well as Ivy Cudgel from a Terastallized Ogerpon-W. Sylveon is also able to survive a Metal Coat-boosted Make It Rain from Gholdengo. Enough Speed is invested for Sylveon to outspeed Chi-Yu when under Tailwind, with the rest dumped into Special Attack.

  • Both Tera Fire and Water allow Sylveon to check problematic Steel- and Fire-types such as Gholdengo, Incineroar and Assault Vest Kingambit, though Tera Water is generally preferred thanks to having fewer weaknesses to common offensive threats. Tera Fire has valuable resistances to Fairy- and Grass-type moves on top of the coverage with Tera Blast; however, it makes Sylveon weak to more metagame threats, such as Landorus and Ogerpon-W.

Bulky Support.description:
Incineroar is the premier non-Restricted Pokemon in the Regulation G metagame thanks to Intimidate and its ability to check centralizing threats such as Calyrex-S for its team. Its access to Fake Out and Parting Shot combined with its great natural bulk make for a strong combination, demanding respect from foes lest they be forced to switch out, leaving themselves vulnerable to Incineroar's allies, or stay on the field outputting negligible damage. Incineroar is naturally blessed with a typing that lets it take on both Restricted Pokemon, such as Lunala and Calyrex-S, and strong non-Restricteds like Chien-Pao, Rillaboom, and Chi-Yu. Will-O-Wisp ruins IronPress Zamazenta-C and Clear Amulet Calyrex-I; this is of great value, as they normally are not hindered by Intimidate since the former relies on its Defense stat to deal damage and the latter almost always runs Clear Amulet. Alternatively, Flare Blitz provides high damage output against Rillaboom and Amoonguss and OHKOes Chien-Pao. Taunt can also be utilized on specific teams, such as those with Calyrex-I, to shut down Amoonguss. Knock Off is crucial to OHKO Calyrex-S while removing items such as Safety Goggles from opposing Incineroar to aid its own partner Amoonguss. Holding Safety Goggles itself allows Incineroar to have a better matchup against Amoonguss, letting it ignore Spore and Rage Powder, but Sitrus Berry can viably be run to provide crucial longevity to Incineroar in this powerful Restricted metagame. The given EV spread allows Incineroar to always survive a Jolly Close Combat from Mienshao. As an added bonus, it also takes a +1 Defense Body Press from Zamazenta-C, allowing it to use Will-O-Wisp or get better positioning against Zamazenta-C's allies. The special bulk EVs allow Incineroar to avoid a 2HKO from +1 Life Orb Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage, letting it retaliate with Knock Off. 27 Speed IVs are run in order to get a slower Parting Shot than opposing Incineroar, allowing the user's Incineroar's Parting Shot to go off onto a freshly switched-in opposing Pokemon for greater value. Tera Ghost allows Incineroar to ignore Fake Out from opposing Incineroar or Rillaboom, Close Combat from Mienshao and either Urshifu forme, and Body Press from Zamazenta-C. Tera Grass lets Incineroar resist Water Spout from Kyogre while being immune to Amoonguss's Spore and Rage Powder, essentially functioning as a built-in Safety Goggles. Alternatively, Tera Water can be used to keep the resistance to Water Spout and resist Calyrex-I's Glacial Lance in exchange for a neutral matchup against opposing Incineroar and being unable to ignore Amoonguss.

Incineroar pairs well with virtually every Restricted Pokemon, providing Fake Out support in conjunction with solid bulk and damage reduction. As useful as Incineroar is, it is severely threatened by Pokemon such as Koraidon and Kyogre, the former of which is immune to Intimidate thanks to Clear Amulet and can easily OHKO Incineroar with Collision Course. The latter is Incineroar's worst matchup, as it easily gets OHKOed by Water Spout and even Origin Pulse if rain is on the field. Miraidon is also a huge nuisance when used with Choice Specs, as it can either potentially OHKO Incineroar with Electro Drift or pivot around it with Volt Switch, chipping it or its allies down. The susceptibility to Koraidon can be mitigated by having Flutter Mane or Fairy Tera Raging Bolt as a partner, as both take advantage of Koraidon's sun via Protosynthesis and force it to Terastallize. Incineroar should also be carefully preserved against Calyrex-I because it commonly runs Clear Amulet and High Horsepower, which can 2HKO Incineroar. Incineroar also struggles against a top non-Restricted Pokemon in Urshifu-R, so allies such as Rillaboom and/or Amoonguss are appreciated to keep it and other threats like Kyogre and Miraidon in check.

Assault Vest.description:
Incineroar is a bulky pivot that uses its good defensive typing, defenses that are bolstered by Assault Vest, and Intimidate to allow its teammates to switch in safely as well as being a check to Pokemon such as Calyrex-S, Zacian-C, and Rillaboom. U-turn allows Incineroar to switch out and get more use out of Intimidate and Fake Out. Assault Vest lets Incineroar survive attacks such as Ursaluna-B's Tera Normal Blood Moon and Pelipper's Weather Ball at the cost of not being able to use common moves like Parting Shot, Will-O-Wisp, and Taunt. The defensive EVs allow Incineroar to take Choice Specs Miraidon's Electro Drift, Landorus's Earth Power, and Mienshao's Close Combat, as well as Calyrex-I's Glacial Lance after Incineroar Terastallizes.Tera Grass lets Incineroar resist moves such as the former two's STAB attacks as well as Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes, which lets Incineroar remove their items with Knock Off or bring in teammate with U-turn while making Incineroar immune to Amoonguss's Spore and Rage Powder.

Incineroar struggles against Pokemon that can threaten it with super effective damage and ignore Intimidate such as Urshifu-R, Koraidon, Landorus, and Pelipper, with the latter three still hitting it super effectively after it Terastallizes. Partners like Miraidon and Lunala can help against Pokemon that threaten Incineroar such as Urshifu-R, Pelipper, and Landorus. Incineroar pairs well with Pokemon like Miraidon that benefit from being able to pivot and can make sure that Electric Terrain is active. Incineroar also uses Flare Blitz to threaten Grass-types like Rillaboom and Amoonguss that resist Miriadon's STAB Electric-type moves. Lunala is another strong partner for Incineroar, as Fake Out can help Lunala set up Trick Room while Incineroar can help strong Trick Room sweepers such as Ursaluna switch in safely. Incineroar also threatens Calyrex-S, which Lunala otherwise struggles against, with Knock Off.

Assault Vest Pivot.description:
• Assault Vest makes Incineroar even bulkier, at the cost of utility in not running Parting Shot or Safety Goggles.

  • The given EV spread allows Incineroar to avoid the 2HKO from Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast and take Landorus's Earth Power, while the Defense EVs let Incineroar survive Close Combat from the Urshifu formes with Sword of Ruin active.

  • Tera Grass is preferred because it flips Incineroar's weaknesses and allows it to be a consistent Amoonguss answer, ignoring Spore and Rage Powder. Incineroar can also use Tera Fairy as a more all-round defensive typing and as a way to check Urshifu-S.

Kommo-o.overview:
• Kommo-o is a strong setup sweeper thanks to its excellent defensive stats and access to STAB Body Press. Its defensive typing gives it critical resistances to the signature moves of both Urshifu formes, which ignore the Defense boosts from Iron Defense. With proper support, Kommo-o is capable of becoming extremely difficult to remove once it starts setting up Iron Defense, making it an extremely effective sweeper.

  • Kommo-o appreciates teammates that help it set up more easily. Incineroar and Amoonguss are great at this, with Incineroar being able to cycle Fake Out and Parting Shot, while Amoonguss provides Spore as well as redirection support. Both give Kommo-o turns to set up and more room to maneuver, and they also have strong defensive synergy with Kommo-o. Ting-Lu is another great partner, as it can whittle down foes with Ruination, and its ability Vessel of Ruin makes Kommo-o harder to remove.

  • Ironically, one of Kommo-o's biggest weaknesses is its typing. While its numerous resistances are valuable, namely into the Ogerpon and Urshifu formes, in exchange, it is weak to a whole host of common offensive types. Strong attackers such as Flutter Mane, Raging Bolt, and Chien-Pao hit Kommo-o for super effective damage, with the former two being special attackers and the latter using Sacred Sword, meaning they all ignore Iron Defense boosts. Kommo-o is often forced to Terastallize, and requires careful positioning around threats to conserve its HP for a late game sweep.

Iron Defense Sweeper.description:
• Iron Head is used to hit Flutter Mane, which is immune to Body Press.

  • Leftovers is used for extra recovery, since Kommo-o will be on the field for long periods of time.

  • Overcoat is picked for an immunity to powder moves, allowing it to ignore Amoonguss, which can otherwise redirect a resisted Body Press and slow it down with Spore.

  • The Special Defense investment allows Kommo-o to live a Blood Moon from Life Orb Ursaluna-B and makes Shadow Ball from Special Attack Booster Energy Flutter Mane a 3HKO. On the physical side, the Defense investment allows Kommo-o to comfortably live Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash, as well as making Urshifu-S's Wicked Blow a 3HKO after Terastallizing into Steel. The Attack investment gives the best chance for an OHKO on Flutter Mane with Iron Head after Terastallizing into Steel.

  • Tera Steel has the best synergy with Kommo-o's original typing since it provides resistances to every type that Kommo-o is weak to. It also gives STAB to Iron Head, allowing for a favorable roll to OHKO Flutter Mane

Calm Mind.description:
Lunala is a strong, bulky special attacker that uses Shadow Shield to safely set up with Calm Mind. Due to its typing, bulk, and ability, Lunala has a positive matchup into Zamazenta-C and threatens to KO the Calyrex formes with Moongeist Beam. Lunala uses Moonblast to hit Dark-types like Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S that resist Moongeist Beam. Calm Mind gives Lunala more bulk to survive against special attackers like Calyrex-S and Miraidon and boosts its damage output, making it a threat. Leftovers provides recovery for Lunala to help it regain Shadow Shield. The defensive investment allows Lunala to live Dark Pulse from Chi-Yu, Shadow Ball from Choice Specs Flutter Mane, and Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S. The offensive investment allows Lunala to OHKO Calyrex-I after a Calm Mind, OHKO Gholdengo, and nearly OHKO bulky Flutter Mane, all with Moongeist Beam. The Speed EVs help outspeed bulky Gholdengo and paralyzed Choice Scarf Urshifu-R. Lunala uses Tera Fairy to remove its weaknesses to Dark- and Ghost-type attacks like Knock Off and Astral Barrage from Incineroar and Calyrex-S, respectively. Tera Fairy also boosts the damage from Moonblast, which helps threaten Dark-types.

Dark- and Ghost-types such as Incineroar, Chi-Yu, and Calyrex-S threaten Lunala with their STAB moves like Knock Off, Snarl, and Astral Barrage, respectively. Amoonguss threatens Lunala with Spore while tanking its attacks. Miraidon threatens Lunala with immediate offensive pressure, preventing Lunala from setting up in front of it. Pelipper helps against Koraidon, Incineroar, and Chi-Yu with Drizzle, threatens to OHKO the latter two with Weather Ball, and helps against Amoonguss with Hurricane. Pelipper's access to Wide Guard protects Lunala from Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage and Chi-Yu's Snarl. Rillaboom is another great option for Lunala thanks to Grassy Terrain, which offers recovery and a way to override Miraidon's Electric Terrain, and Fake Out, allowing Lunala to set up with Calm Mind. Urshifu-R provides offensive pressure on a lot of Lunala's threats like Chi-Yu, Incineroar, Chien-Pao, Calyrex-S, Terapagos, and Ursaluna-B and synergizes well with Pelipper thanks to rain boosting Surging Strikes and Rillaboom because it handles Fire-types that threaten Rillaboom. Incineroar can use Taunt to shut down Amoonguss, has Intimidate to weaken physical threats such as Zacian-C and Chien-Pao, and has access to Fake Out, making it a great partner for Lunala to set up next to. Grimmsnarl helps Lunala survive against offensive threats such as Miraidon, Koraidon, and the Calyrex formes thanks to Prankster Light Screen and Reflect reducing the damage Lunala and its allies will be taking while providing speed control in Thunder Wave.

Bulky Attacker.description:
Lunala is a strong bulky attacker with a great defensive ability in Shadow Shield, valuable support tools in Wide Guard and Trick Room, and the threatening Power Herb + Meteor Beam combination. Meteor Beam gives Lunala a strong setup option while having the extra benefit of doing major damage to Incineroar and other Pokemon weak to Rock. Lunala's access to Wide Guard paired with its Ghost typing gives it a favorable matchup into popular restricted Pokemon like Calyrex-I and Zamazenta-C by blocking their strong STAB moves in Body Press and Glacial Lance, respectively. Trick Room allows Lunala to set the pace of the match to its favor, with Moonblast being a solid alternative to cover for Dark-types when speed control isn't necessary. The EV spread allows Lunala to take Wicked Blow and Life Orb-boosted Astral Barrage from Urshifu-S and Calyrex-S with Shadow Shield active. Tera Fairy removes Lunala's Dark and Ghost weaknesses while being a strong defensive typing itself, giving Lunala the opportunity to safely stay in against would-be checks like Incineroar and Flutter Mane while having the extra benefit of boosting Moonblast.

Lunala naturally struggles against Dark- and Normal-types like Incineroar and Terapagos, both taking negligible to no damage from Moongeist Beam once Power Herb is used up by Meteor Beam. Calyrex-S also forces Lunala to either use Wide Guard or Terastallize to avoid major damage. Urshifu-R is a phenomenal partner for Lunala, as it's able to cover Lunala's weaknesses and OHKO threatening Pokemon like Incineroar, Terapagos, and Calyrex-S; it is also protected by Lunala's Wide Guard from strong spread moves like Bleakwind Storm and Astral Barrage. Incineroar also forms a solid defensive backbone when paired with Urshifu-R as well as generating opportunities for Lunala to set up Trick Room with Fake Out. Amoonguss provides redirection support as well as Pollen Puff healing to keep Lunala at full HP for Shadow Shield; it also synergizes extremely well with Lunala's other common partners like Urshifu-R and Incineroar. Tailwind + Trick Room teams that run Lunala also benefit from strong Tailwind setters like Tornadus and Whimsicott, giving Lunala the flexibility to go for a fast game mode in specific matchups.

Rillaboom.overview:
• Rillaboom maintains its status as a premier Fake Out pivot thanks to U-turn, Grassy Glide, and Grassy Terrain. Rillaboom fits on many archetypes and has a wide range of playstyles. Rillaboom is a great counter to Water-types like Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W, as it is able to switch into their attacks and pressure them for huge damage if not a KO.

  • Assault Vest Rillaboom is the most common set currently, as it checks Flutter Mane, and can switch in on special threats and threaten with Fake Out or Grassy Glide.

  • Common Rillaboom partners include Urshifu-R and Incineroar to complete the Fire / Water / Grass core, and more offensive sets pair well with Entei and Chien-Pao with priority spam. Other great partners are defensive Pokemon such as Calm Mind Raging Bolt that benefit from Grassy Terrain recovery and Fake Out.

  • Common Rillaboom checks include Fire-types, Intimidate Pokemon to greatly reduce Rillaboom's damage output, and Pokemon that resist Grass. This includes Entei, Dragonite, and especially Incineroar.

Offensive Pivot.description:
• Rillaboom is generally restricted to Fake Out, Wood Hammer, and Grassy Glide, with the 4th move usually being U-turn to pivot and sometimes High Horsepower to check Fire- and Steel-types, that would otherwise completely wall Rillaboom.

  • Rillaboom may run Tera Grass to boost its already high levels of damage, or Tera Fire to stay in on common threats such as Incineroar and Chien-Pao and U-turn out to safely bring in a frailer Pokemon.

  • The EV spread allows Rillaboom to almost always survive Entei's Sacred Fire and avoid the 2HKO from Protosythesis-boosted Flutter Mane's Moonblast while retaliating with a OHKO. Thanks to its priority moves, Rillaboom can afford to not invest in Speed.

Offensive Nuke.description:
• Maximum Attack along with Tera Grass allows Rillaboom to always KO Flutter Mane with Sword of Ruin-boosted Grassy Glide. Protect is favored as the last move, as Rillaboom loses a lot of the bulk from the Assault Vest.

  • This set generally looks for all-or-nothing plays, picking up OHKOs against common tanks such as Iron Hands, Farigiraf, and Ogerpon-W with Wood Hammer, and picking up KOs on frailer pokemon with Grassy Glide.

  • This set can struggle against Intimidate, especially Incineroar, as the sudden drop to its Attack can severely minimize the absurdity of Rillaboom's attacks, allowing bulkier Pokemon to survive a boosted Wood Hammer.

  • The EV spread allows Rillaboom to survive Tera Stellar Ice Spinner from Chien-Pao at -1 and almost always take Fairy Feather Tera Fairy Flutter Mane's Moonblast. Rillaboom can afford to forgo Speed investment, as it already outspeeds common slow Pokemon like Farigiraf and Incineroar.

Offensive.description:
Rillaboom's offensive prowess and strong STAB moves, boosted further by Grassy Terrain, make it one of strongest physical attackers in the metagame. Grassy Terrain also plays an important role of overriding other Terrains such as Electric Terrain from Miraidon and Psychic Terrain from Indeedee-F. Grassy Glide is used, since it allows Rillaboom to threaten Pokemon that are faster than it like Urshifu-R. High Horsepower is used to threaten super effective damage on Pokemon like Raging Bolt, Miraidon, and Incineroar. U-turn allows Rillaboom to switch in and out of the battle, helping it reset Grassy Terrain consistently. Protect can be utilized on Miracle Seed variants to block Fake Out as well as stall Trick Room. Choice Band allows Rillaboom to OHKO foes it normally doesn't, while Miracle Seed allows Rillaboom to use Fake Out and means that Rillaboom isn't locked into a single move. The EV spread allows Rillaboom to OHKO Urshifu-R with Miracle Seed Grassy Glide and almost always OHKO Calyrex-I with Choice Band Tera Grass Wood Hammer. In conjunction with Choice Band, Rillaboom can OHKO Miraidon with High Horsepower. The defensive investment allows Rillaboom to survive a Flare Blitz from Incineroar. Tera Grass is used to amplify Rillaboom's damage, while Tera Fire is used defensively to resist Fire- and Ice-type moves like Flare Blitz from Incineroar and Ice Spinner from Chien-Pao. Tera Fire can also be used to gain immunity to Will-O-Wisp.

Rillaboom is a great partner to Zamazenta-C, which appreciates its offensive capability to threaten Pokemon like Urshifu-R, Calyrex-S, and Kyogre. Wide Guard support from Zamazenta-C can protect Rillaboom from spread moves like Glacial Lance and Astral Barrage, allowing it to stay on the field longer. Rillaboom pairs well with Chien-Pao, which provides another multiplier to Rillaboom's nuclear damage through Sword of Ruin; in return, Rillaboom helps Chien-Pao by OHKOing Urshifu-R. Urshifu-R and Incineroar are great teammates as well, as the trio forms the Fire / Water / Grass core. Rillaboom has a bad matchup against Incineroar and Tornadus, which resist its moves and threaten it with Flare Blitz and Bleakwind Storm, respectively. Furthermore, Incineroar is a counter to Rillaboom thanks to Intimidate and its ability to threaten Fake Out on Choice Band variants. Chien-Pao is another check, which can survive one attack thanks to Focus Sash and OHKO Rillaboom with Ice Spinner or Icicle Crash.

Hatterene.overview:
• Wielding the highest Special Attack of any Pokemon to get Expanding Force and Speed lower than even Amoonguss, Hatterene is the poster child for Trick Room variants of Psychic-type spam teams. It deals with many of the usual Trick Room answers, including Iron Hands and Amoonguss, even being immune to the latter's Spore due to Magic Bounce. Magic Bounce also prevents potential Taunt users from shutting down Trick Room.

  • Hatterene requires two things to succeed; Trick Room and Psychic Terrain. Indeedee-F provides both with Psychic Surge, Trick Room, and Follow Me to help Hatterene set up its own Trick Room. It is nearly impossible to deny Trick Room against a lead of Hatterene and Indeedee-F. Torkoal and Ursaluna deal with Steel-types that resist both of Hatterene's STAB moves, and they also benefit from Trick Room.

  • Aforementioned Steel-types like Gholdengo are tougher to break through for Hatterene, as well as Dark-types that take neutral damage from Dazzling Gleam, such as Incineroar, Kingambit, and Chi-Yu, the latter of which has Snarl to lower Hatterene's damage output. Assault Vest Raging Bolt running Snarl also slows Hatterene down, despite being weak to Dazzling Gleam. Rillaboom changing the terrain, weakening Expanding Force greatly, and allowing priority moves to go through can also be a huge blow to a gameplan involving Hatterene.

  • Lastly, like most Trick Room sweepers, Hatterene is susceptible to Trick Room either being denied or fully stalled out, leaving it defenseless.

Bulky Life Orb Attacker.description:
• Tera Psychic boosts Hatterene's damage output to scary levels, allowing it to OHKO Ursaluna-B and have a favorable roll to OHKO bulky Flutter Mane. Alternatively, Tera Fire is a great defensive typing against the Flutter Mane and Chi-Yu combination, as well as Gholdengo.

  • 212 HP EVs minimize Life Orb recoil, and 100 Defense EVs alongside them allow Hatterene to always survive Adamant Tera Dark Urshifu-S's Wicked Blow. The rest of the EVs are invested in Special Attack to maximize damage output, and a Quiet nature + 0 Speed IVs ensures you move before minimum Speed Amoonguss in Trick Room.

Written by: https://www.smogon.com/forums/members/soulboyvgc.558405/ Quality checked by: https://www.smogon.com/forums/members/lameliarleo.641287/ Grammar checked by: https://www.smogon.com/forums/members/clouds.356215/

Light Clay.description:
Grimmsnarl is a reliable defensive support tool for teams in Regulation G. Spirit Break threatens Koraidon and the Urshifu formes, and it also lowers the Special Attack of strong Pokemon like Terapaos and Calyrex-S. Foul Play is also good insurance against both Calyrex-S and Calyrex-I, forcing them to Terastallize if they don't want to take a lot of damage. Thunder Wave provides speed control to allow Grimmsnarl's allies to outspeed foes after they've been paralyzed. Light Clay makes Reflect and Light Screen last longer, allowing it to utilize its other two moves more often. The EVs put into Defense allow Grimmsnarl to always survive a Behemoth Blade from Zacian-C through Reflect after an Intimidate and almost always survive Tera Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R. The EVs put into Special Defense give Grimmsnarl the bulk to survive Electro Drift from Choice Specs Miraidon through Light Screen. Tera Ghost is used to avoid Fake Out, which ruins Grimmsnarl's momentum.

Fake Out is often used to prevent Grimmsnarl from setting Light Screen and Reflect up and can lead to being KOed by double targeting before it moves. To work around Fake Out, exert pressure using Grimmsnarl's partner. Grimmsnarl is typically paired with Terapagos or Kyogre to allow them to shrug off hits as they sweep. Rillaboom and Incineroar are other good options to pair with Grimmsnarl, as their support kit adds to the overall longevity of the team, allowing for stronger Pokemon to get more attacks off. Rillaboom in particular is one of the fastest Pokemon in the metagame that uses Fake Out, which makes it a great option to lead alongside Grimmsnarl to ensure dual screens are set up. Iron Hands and Urshifu-R are also common partners for Grimmsnarl. Iron Hands also provides Fake Out support and a pivoting move, and its Fighting-type STAB option is useful for doing damage to opposing Incineroar, which can use Taunt to disable Grimmsnarl's support moves. Urshifu-R can remove threats to Grimmsnarl like Incineroar and use Taunt to stop foes from using status moves like Taunt and Spore, which stop Grimmsnarl from using its support tools.

Bulky Support.description:
Indeedee-F's typing, ability, and movepool make it an excellent support Pokemon. Its Normal / Psychic typing allows it to deal with Calyrex-S well, and Psychic Surge has immense utility in Regulation G, as it blocks priority moves like Fake Out from Incineroar and Rillaboom and Prankster Taunt from Tornadus while also denying the Terrains that power up Miraidon and Rillaboom. The combination of Follow Me and Trick Room allows Indeedee-F to threaten either setting up Trick Room itself or redirecting away attacking moves and Taunt to enable a partner to set up Trick Room. Once the dimensions have been twisted, it can use Helping Hand to make a partner Trick Room sweeper even more threatening. Its last move is usually an attacking move to make it less prone to Taunt; Dazzling Gleam pairs well with Tera Fairy and lets it damage both foes, while Psychic gives it a strong Psychic Terrain-boosted STAB move regardless of Tera type. Alluring Voice is an acceptable alternative to Dazzling Gleam, letting Indeedee-F punish setup sweepers like IronPress Zamazenta-C and Nasty Plot Calyrex-S while also bypassing the prominent Wide Guard. The Fairy-type attacks allow Indeedee-F to break Focus Sashes on Dark-types like Chien-Pao, Chi-Yu, and Urshifu so its partner can remove them quickly. However, Psychic allows Indeedee-F to OHKO Urshifu-R. Psychic Seed complements Psychic Surge well, as it reinforces Indeedee-F's special bulk. Safety Goggles allows it to bypass Amoonguss's Rage Powder and redirect away Spore for the benefit of its teammates, while Rocky Helmet lets it damage physical attackers whose contact moves it can redirect; Rocky Helmet can even break a Focus Sash from an Urshifu or Chien-Pao and severely punish Urshifu-R for using Surging Strikes. Tera Fairy allows Indeedee-F to resist the Dark-type attacks that would otherwise threaten it such as Incineroar's Knock Off and Urshifu's Wicked Blow while powering up Fairy-type moves that it may carry. Alternatively, Tera Grass lets it bypass Amoonguss's disruption and become immune to its Spore without having to use Safety Goggles while also granting a resistance to Water- and Electric-type attacks from the likes of Urshifu-R and Miraidon.

With Indeedee-F's utility, it can fit on a variety of teams that appreciate Psychic Terrain, redirection, or its ability to set Trick Room. Calyrex-S appreciates Psychic Terrain blocking priority moves, namely Chien-Pao's Sucker Punch, and powering up its Psychic-type attacks; it is even able to run the devastating Expanding Force with Indeedee-F. Calyrex-S also takes advantage of Indeedee-F's redirection to fire off more of its brutal attacks without fear of retaliation and also benefits from Helping Hand pushing its damage potential up to eleven. Calyrex-I pairs well with Indeedee-F, as it is both a Trick Room setter and a sweeper, meaning that the opponent is hard-pressed to stop either Pokemon from setting up Trick Room with Indeedee-F's support, and once it is set up, Indeedee-F immediately enables Calyrex-I to deal big damage with Helping Hand. Other Trick Room sweepers like Ursaluna, Ursaluna-B, and Torkoal appreciate that Indeedee-F can support them with Helping Hand and Follow Me on top of its ability to set up Trick Room. Indeedee-F is very vulnerable to Dark-types like Urshifu, Chi-Yu, and Incineroar, as the threat of their powerful moves makes it more hesitant to use Follow Me. It also hates Taunt, which completely shuts down all of its utility and thus its field presence. Rillaboom can also interfere with strategies predicated on Psychic Terrain blocking Fake Out.

Offensive.description:
Zacian-C is a strong Restricted Pokemon in Regulation G, thanks to its superb typing as well as great Attack and Speed stats, which allow it to remove fast metagame threats such as Miraidon, Flutter Mane, and Koraidon. Play Rough threatens Koraidon and common Steel-resistant foes like Raging Bolt, Iron Hands, and Urshifu-R. Swords Dance allows Zacian-C to boost past Incineroar's Intimidate and remain a strong threat on the field. Sacred Sword can be used over either of these to threaten a 2HKO on Pokemon Zacian-C may otherwise struggle to break through, such as Incineroar and Zamazenta-C. Tera Blast can be used in conjunction with Tera Ground to also threaten Incineroar and Zamazenta-C, as well as Tera Electric Miraidon, Tera Fire Koraidon, and Gholdengo. However, Tera Blast can't break through IronPress Zamazenta-C and requires Zacian-C to commit to Terastallizaion. The defensive EVs allow Zacian-C to survive +3 Body Press from Zamazenta-C and avoid the 2HKO from Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage, while the Attack investment provides Zacian-C with the ability to 2HKO bulky Calyrex-S with Behemoth Blade after Intimidate. The Speed EVs allow Zacian-C to outspeed 135 speed foes that have a neutral nature, such as Modest Miraidon. Zacian-C may opt for 108 Attack and 164 Speed with a Jolly nature, to outspeed Base 135s with a boosting nature, like Jolly Chien-Pao. Tera Fairy sheds Zacian-C's weaknesses to Fire- and Ground-type moves such as Chi-Yu's Heat Wave and Ursaluna-B's Earth Power and greatly boosts its damage, allowing Zacian-C to OHKO Kyogre and Terastallized Miraidon. Tera Ground grants Zacian-C incredible coverage and an immunity to Miraidon's Electric-type STAB moves. Alternatively, Tera Dragon provides Zacian-C with valuable resistances to Water-, Electric-, and Fire-type moves, allowing it to take attacks from threats like Urshifu-R, Miraidon, and Chi-Yu significantly better.

Zacian-C especially struggles with Incineroar, which weakens it through Intimidate and can further cripple it with Will-O-Wisp or threaten it with Flare Blitz. Zacian-C also struggles to damage Fire- and Steel-types like Ogerpon-H, Tera Fire Calyrex-I, Gholdengo, and Zamazenta-C if not packing coverage. This makes Urshifu-R an excellent partner, as it can threaten all of Zacian-C's checks and appreciates how Zacian-C reliably removes Raging Bolt and Miraidon. Chien-Pao can use Sacred Sword to threaten Zamazenta-C and Incineroar, as well as help Zacian-C break through the above checks with Sword of Ruin. Tailwind from Pokemon like Tornadus and Whimsicott is greatly appreciated, allowing Zacian-C to maintain its Speed advantage against opposing speed control. Amooonguss can be troublesome, as it takes Zacian-C's attacks well and can slow it down with Spore. In the balance mirror matchup, the Calyrex formes can also be troublesome for Zacian-C, as they are faster in their respective forms of speed control and can output more damage than Zacian-C. Umbreon and Chi-Yu are excellent partners for this reason. Umbreon can utilize its Fake Out immunity to shut down Amoonguss and prevent Trick Room with Taunt while also doing huge damage to both Calyrex formes with Foul Play. Chi-Yu can threaten Amoonguss and the Calyrex formes with Heat Wave and Dark Pulse, respectively. The two also provide Snarl utility to further minimize the threat of Calyrex-S.

IronPress Sweeper.description:
IronPress Zamazenta-C is one of the most dangerous physical setup sweepers in Regulation G, leveraging its amazing bulk and typing to take over games without being slowed down by Intimidate. Fighting is an excellent offensive type in the current metagame, giving Zamazenta-C a great matchup spread against common Restricted Pokemon like Terapagos, Calyrex-I, Groudon, and Zacian-C; in addition, the popularity of Dark-types like Incineroar, Ting-Lu, and Chien-Pao is great news for it. Heavy Slam is a useful secondary STAB move that importantly covers Flutter Mane and damages other Fighting-resistant Pokemon more than an unboosted Body Press, reducing the amount of team support Zamazenta-C needs to circumvent its checks. Behemoth Bash can be used instead to threaten a 2HKO on Tera Fairy Raging Bolt and a potential 2HKO on Calyrex-I. Wide Guard is an amazing utility option that can be used over Iron Defense or Protect as it protects against deadly spread moves like Astral Barrage and Water Spout, improving the Calyrex-S and Kyogre matchups considerably. 84 Defense EVs with an Impish nature give Body Press enough power to OHKO Miraidon and 2HKO most Fighting-resistant Pokemon after an Iron Defense boost, most notably Landorus and Tornadus, assuming Dauntless Shield is active. The given special bulk investment allows Zamazenta-C to survive Choice Scarf Chi-Yu's Flamethrower and avoid a 2HKO from most Flutter Mane variants. The Speed investment ensures that Zamazenta-C will outrun Adamant Ogerpon formes. Tera Grass is the most consistent Tera type, keeping Zamazenta-C's Fire weakness and worsens its chances against Flying-types like Tornadus; in exchange, it becomes immune to Amoonguss's powder moves and gains a resistance to Ground- and Electric-type attacks, which helps it greatly against Landorus, Miraidon, and Raging Bolt. Alternatively, Tera Water lets Zamazenta-C shed all of its type weaknesses and gives it key resistances to Fire and Water, the latter of which is especially useful against Kyogre and Urshifu-R.

As a bulky setup sweeper, Zamazenta-C performs at its best when its team is built around damage mitigation and redirection strategies, giving it as many opportunities as possible to set up Iron Defense and fire off its attacks. Rillaboom is an excellent partner that helps Zamazenta-C by providing Fake Out support, recovery from Grassy Terrain, speed control with Grassy Glide, and a useful typing that lets it check Miraidon and Kyogre. Incineroar can make Zamazenta-C even more unbreakable on the physical side with Fake Out and Intimidate, and as a Dark-type, it provides an important check to Calyrex-S. Raging Bolt boasts great offensive and defensive synergy with Zamazenta-C, picking off weakened targets with Thunderclap while helping against Kyogre and Urshifu-R; it can also run an effective Calm Mind set that appreciates the support options that Zamazenta-C wants on its team anyway. Redirectors like Amoonguss and Ogerpon-W give Zamazenta-C even more setup opportunities, and the former can take this a step further by disabling foes with Spore and healing Zamazenta-C with Pollen Puff. Flutter Mane can slow down faster Pokemon with Icy Wind or help break physical tanks with a Choice Specs set; either way, it's great for threatening faster Restricted Pokemon like Koraidon, Miraidon, and Calyrex-S. Ting-Lu can augment Zamazenta-C's special bulk with Vessel of Ruin, check Miraidon and Calyrex-S, and chip foes into Body Press's KO range with Ruination.

Offensive Sweeper.description:
Urshifu-S is used as a generally strong attacker, its Wicked Blow deals massive damage to much of the metagame and ignores Attack drops and Protect, minimizing counterplay. It is a versatile pick on many compositions, as its kit does not need much support and is mainly used to enhance a team's offensive pressure with strong attacks. With Tera Dark, Urshifu-S is capable of OHKOing Pokemon such as both Calyrex formes and Flutter Mane as well as bringing most other targets down to low HP, such as Miraidon and Tornadus. Focus Sash helps Urshifu-S remedy its poor defensive typing, while Sucker Punch is able to somewhat bypass Urshifu-S's middling Speed tier.

Urshifu-S functions well on many teams, but those with strong speed control are where Urshifu-S shines, particularly Trick Room compositions with Calyrex-I, which appreciate the immediate pressure. Trick Room lets Urshifu-S outspeed threats such as Flutter Mane and Zamazenta-C. Additionally, Unseen Fist ignoring Protect means that it is more risky for foes to attempt to stall out Trick Room turns. Urshifu-S struggles against Pokemon that resist Dark, such as opposing Incineroar and Urshifu, as they nullify Urshifu-S's main benefit in dealing big damage with Wicked Blow. While Close Combat is strong, it's less consistent because it doesnt bypass Intimidate and drops Urshifu-S's defenses. Additionally, many of these threats also outspeed and Urshifu-S for super effective damage, such as the Zamazenta-C and Urshifu-R. However, Pokemon like Amoonguss and Incineroar are able to somewhat make up for these weaknesses. Amoonguss provides redirection, resists Fairy and Fighting, and threatens foes with Spore, while Incineroar offers general utility and Fake Out, which foes can't block with Protect at risk of a attack from Urshifu-S. Tera Fairy is also a popular Tera type, used by foes like Raging Bolt and Calyrex-S, which are problematic for Urshifu-S as it cannot break through Tera Fairy users because they resist its STAB combination

Focus Sash.description:
• Close Combat hits common Dark-resistant Pokemon such as Incineroar and Kingambit. Sucker Punch provides priority and makes up for Urshifu-S's average Speed tier.

  • Urshifu-S uses Tera Dark to fire off strong Wicked Blows or Tera Stellar to boost the damage output of its STAB moves. Tera-boosted Close Combat OHKOes common Incineroar at -1 Attack, and both Tera types will allow Urshifu-S to OHKO Flutter Mane, provided its boost is still intact for Dark-type moves.

  • Focus Sash allows Urshifu-S to survive any one attack, making up for its poor defensive typing. In contrast to Choice items, it gives Urshifu-S the freedom to switch moves and use Detect when threatened, which is especially strong against Fake Out leads.

  • The extra EVs in Defense are to maximize Urshifu-S's chance of surviving a use of Surging Strikes from Tera Water Mystic Water Urshifu-R.

Choice Band.description:
• Choice Band is used to guarantee an OHKO on common targets like Landorus, Ogerpon-H, Flutter Mane, and even Tornadus that are not invested heavily in physical bulk. Even naturally bulky Pokemon such as Dragonite and Walking Wake can be OHKOed or put in the range for minimal damage to KO them.

  • Poison Jab is excellent coverage, hitting the problematic Fairy-types that Urshifu-S normally struggles with. After Terastallization, you can guarantee an OHKO on almost all Rillaboom, Terastallized Flutter mane, and even bulkier pokemon like Tera Fairy Indeedee-F. U-turn is also a viable move as a pivot option.

  • The Attack investment and Adamant nature are necessary to get the KOs mentioned earlier, such as the OHKO on Landorus and Tornadus. The Defense investment allows Urshifu-S to survive the combination of Tera Normal Choice Band Dragonite's Extreme Speed and Sucker Punch from Adamant Chien-Pao. The Special Defense EVs allow Urshifu-S to take a variety of strong attacks such as Earth Power from Landorus and Bleakwind Storm from Tornadus. The remaining EVs are placed in Speed.

  • Tera Poison is chosen to resist the Fighting- and Fairy-type moves that would otherwise hit Urshifu-S super effectively. Urshifu-S is naturally immune to Psychic and has Dark-type moves to cover for the weakness, and it also naturally threatens Psychic-types like Farigiraf. Tera Dark is also an option, as the extra damage combined with Choice Band is absurd and, combined with good Tailwind support and redirection, is a good choice. However, it requires more careful positioning around threats, as Urshifu-S won't be able to Terastallize out of it's Fairy- and Fighting-type weaknesses.

Choice Scarf.description:
Choice Scarf Urshifu-R is an excellent revenge killer and cleaner against many offensive Pokemon. The Choice Scarf lets Urshifu-R outspeed the dangerous Calyrex-S, meaning that the vast majority of offensive teams get naturally outsped and destroyed by its powerful Surging Strikes or Close Combat, and with Unseen Fist, these teams cannot even attempt to outplay it with Protect. U-turn lets Urshifu-R use the threat of its powerful attacks to pivot out, letting its team maintain momentum even when the opponent tries to switch around its attacks while also letting it 2HKO Ogerpon-W. Aqua Jet lets Urshifu-R bypass opposing speed control and priority moves when revenge killing an opposing threat, whereas Coaching makes partner Calyrex-I a significantly bigger threat. Tera Water powers up its Surging Strikes, letting it destroy foes like Calyrex-S. It also lets Urshifu-R shed its weaknesses to Psychic and Fairy, letting it potentially take attacks like Flutter Mane's Dazzling Gleam and Calyrex-S's Psychic-type moves. This set maximizes both Urshifu-R's Attack and Speed to make it as fast and strong as possible, but an EV spread of 60 HP / 156 Atk / 20 Def / 20 SpD / 252 Spe with an Adamant nature can be also used to survive Rillaboom's Grassy Glide and Mystic Water Kyogre's Water Spout.

Redirectors such as Rage Powder Amoonguss and Follow Me Ogerpon-W disrupt Urshifu-R very effectively, interfering with it attacking vulnerable targets. Rillaboom's Grassy Glide bypasses Urshifu-R's great Speed and threatens it with an OHKO. Miraidon and Raging Bolt both threaten Urshifu-R with their powerful Electro Drift and Thunderclap, respectively. Koraidon, Groudon, and even Tornadus can set up sun, weakening Surging Strikes so that Urshifu-R can be played around more easily. Additionally, a good way to subvert Urshifu-R's great Speed is with opposing speed control. Users include Tailwind Tornadus, Icy Wind Flutter Mane, and Trick Room Calyrex-I or Farigiraf. Urshifu-R's best partner is Tornadus, as it can support Urshifu-R with Tailwind to counter opposing speed control, Rain Dance to boost the power of Urshifu-R's Water-type STAB moves, and Bleakwind Storm to threaten opposing Grass-types like Rillaboom that would threaten Urshifu-R. It can also use Taunt to ensure that Amoonguss cannot use Spore or Rage Powder to disrupt Urshifu-R. Pelipper provides rain with its ability and has a STAB Flying-type attack in Hurricane to threaten Grass-types, and it can use Wide Guard to protect Urshifu-R from the variety of spread moves in the format, including Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S and Water Spout from Kyogre. It also can support Urshifu-R with Helping Hand. Amoonguss can handle Electric- and Grass-types that would threaten Urshifu-R by redirecting attacks away from it with Rage Powder. Urshifu-R forms a formidable pivoting core with Rillaboom and Incineroar, with the three spamming U-turn or Parting Shot to stay ahead of the opponent's switches, reactivate Fake Out, cycle Intimidate, and let Urshifu-R choose new moves to lock into. Incineroar helps take on opposing Rillaboom and Amoonguss for Urshifu-R, while Rillaboom deals with Kyogre and opposing Urshifu-R well and slows down Miraidon. Both of them can use Fake Out to prevent one of the opposing Pokemon from attacking, letting Urshifu-R attack the other without interference. Fake Out also often forces foes to use Protect, which Urshifu-R can attack through.

Bulky Attacker.description:
Urshifu-R is an excellent offensive Pokemon that can threaten metagame staples such as Incineroar, Chien-Pao, and Terapagos thanks to its fantastic typing and STAB moves, enabled by Unseen Fist. Taunt is utilized to shut down supportive Pokemon and Trick Room setters such as Amoonguss and Farigiraf as well as prevent Pokemon like Calm Mind Terapagos and Raging Bolt from setting up. Aqua Jet is a great alternative to get around Raging Bolt's Thunderclap and pick off weakened foes, which is especially useful, as Urshifu-R ignores Protect. Urshifu-R may opt for Swords Dance to become a deadly sweeper, allowing it to OHKO Rillaboom and, after Intimidate, Terapagos-S with Close Combat. Mystic Water boosts Urshifu-R's STAB moves without drawback and allows it to OHKO Incineroar through Sitrus Berry. Safety Goggles lets Urshifu-R ignore Amoonguss's Spore and Rage Powder, which is significant, as Amoonguss resists Urshifu-R's STAB moves; this also provides opportunities for Urshifu-R to set up. The defensive investment allows Urshifu-R to survive Rillaboom's Miracle Seed-boosted Grassy Glide and almost always survive Raging Bolt's Thunderclap. The Speed EVs allow Urshifu-R to outspeed -1 Flutter Mane and Miraidon. Tera Water sheds Urshifu-R's weaknesses to Flutter Mane's Fairy-type STAB moves, Calyrex-S's Psyshock, and Pelipper's Hurricane, as well as greatly boosting its damage output, allowing it to 2HKO Calyrex-I with Surging Strikes and OHKO Chi-Yu with Aqua Jet once Terastallized. Urshifu-R may use Tera Grass to obtain resistances to Rillaboom and Raging Bolt's priority attacks as well as a Spore and Rage Powder immunity. Tera Ghost can be opted for instead to provide Urshifu-R with a Fake Out immunity, allowing it to keep momentum, and a Fighting immunity that lets Urshifu-R take on Zamazenta-C.

Urshifu-R struggles against Rillaboom and Raging Bolt, which take its attacks exceptionally well and threaten it with strong priority STAB moves. Ogerpon-W is also an issue, as it can redirect Surging Strikes and is faster, allowing it to hit Urshifu-R for huge damage with Horn Leech. This makes Tornadus and Amoonguss great partners, as Tornadus can threaten the Grass-types, and Amoonguss can protect Urshifu-R from Raging Bolt with Rage Powder. Tornadus can also provide speed and weather control, making up for Urshifu-R's mediocre Speed tier and handling the otherwise problematic Koraidon, which can significantly weaken Urshifu-R with the sun it sets up. Taunt is another great tool that allows Tornadus to shut down Amoonguss for Urshifu-R. Urshifu-R can take on threats like Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu for the two in return. Alternatively, Rillaboom is an excellent pick, as it can pivot in Urshifu-R and threaten Ogerpon-W. Incineroar can pair with Urshifu-R and either Amoonguss or Rillaboom to create a fantastic pivot core, switching in on threats like Rillaboom. Rillaboom and Incineroar also bring Fake Out, which synergises with Unseen Fist. Urshifu-R is also a great asset to Calyrex-S, as it has the ability to remove Ghost-resistant foes like Incineroar and Terapagos.

Glass Cannon.description:
Urshifu-R is one of the strongest physical attackers in the format and can punish defensive plays with its ability Unseen Fist. It has a great matchup into Incineroar, since it ignores Intimidate with its signature move Surging Strikes, can switch into Chien-Pao and Calyrex-I, and is able to deal significant damage to Terapagos with Close Combat. Aqua Jet is almost unstoppable with Unseen Fist and can pick off Pokemon low on HP or deal damage before Urshifu-R gets KOed. Taunt gives it a much better matchup into Amoonguss, shutting it down almost completely, and it prevents Calyrex-I from setting up Trick Room. Focus Sash gives it more survivability and helps with its relatively low Special Defense. Tera Water allows Urshifu-R to deal incredibly high damage with Surging Strikes, allowing for an OHKO against common threats such as Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao through Focus Sash. Tera Stellar lets it OHKO Terapagos-S with Close Combat but loses the consistency of Tera Water, since Urshifu-R can no longer use boosted Surging Strikes repeatedly.

Urshifu-R works incredibly well in Calyrex-S teams, since it can threaten the Normal- and Dark-types that Calyrex-S struggles with, such as Terapagos and Incineroar. In exchange, Calyrex-S can deal with Raging Bolt, which is one of the most common checks to Urshifu-R, as Raging Bolt can use Thunderclap before Urshifu-R can move to bring it down to Focus Sash while also being able to switch-in on Surging Strikes. Urshifu-R synergizes well with Rillaboom and Incineroar, since Fake Out and Unseen Fist are a deadly combination, punishing passive plays such as Protect that try to avoid the flinching turn. Their typings also have incredible synergy with each other, allowing them to switch in on many attacks that Urshifu-R is threatened by. With its great physical bulk and natural type advantage, Rillaboom is a great check to it, slowing Urshifu-R down with Fake Out or doing high damage to it with Wood Hammer or Grassy Glide. Urshifu-R also struggles with Amoonguss, which is able to completely wall it while protecting its teammates with Rage Powder or putting it to sleep with Spore. Tornadus is a good partner for Urshifu-R, helping with its average Speed stat by setting up Tailwind, heavily increasing the damage Urshifu-R does while making the Koraidon matchup easier by using Rain Dance and threatening the Grass-types which could otherwise be problematic such as Amoonguss and Rillaboom with Bleakwind Storm. Koraidon and Miraidon are some of the Restricted Pokemon that have the best matchup into Urshifu-R, as Koraidon is able to set up sun and greatly reduce its damage, while Miraidon is able to outspeed it and bring it down to Focus Sash while also pivoting out with Volt Switch.

Mystic Water.description:
• Aqua Jet picks off weakened Flutter Mane, Chien-Pao, and Entei, which are normally faster than Urshifu-R.

  • The Defense investment helps Urshifu-R take a Choice Band, Tera Normal Dragonite Extreme Speed from maximum Attack Dragonite even with Sword of Ruin active on the battlefield, as well as a Miracle Seed Rillaboom Grassy Glide. The Special Defense EVs let Urshifu-R almost always survive Thunderclap from Raging Bolt and Dazzling Gleam from Choice Specs Flutter Mane. The Speed EVs let Urshifu-R outspeed -1 Roaring Moon and Adamant Chien-Pao.

Three Attacks.description:
Regidrago is an offensive threat with great damage potential thanks to the combination of Dragon's Maw and its amazing Dragon-type STAB options. Draco Meteor gives Regidrago a powerful single-target burst option, being able to do massive damage to a majority of the format. While Dragon Pulse is weaker, it deals consistent damage over time, making it better for situations where the power of Draco Meteor is not necessary. Earth Power brings solid coverage into Regidrago's moveset for opposing Steel-types at the cost of not doing great damage due to it not being STAB- or Dragon's Maw-boosted. Tera Blast pairs well with Tera Ghost to threaten Ghost-weak Pokemon such as Calyrex-S and Gholdengo. Life Orb helps increase Regidrago's damage output to insane levels, with the drawback of making Dragon Energy weaker over time; Dragon Fang, on the other hand, sacrifices higher damage output for the lack of recoil, giving Regidrago's Dragon Energy and bulk more consistency. Tera Dragon pushes Regidrago's damage even further, allowing it to pick up KOs on extremely bulky Pokemon like Calyrex-I with Draco Meteor and Helping Hand-boosted Dragon Energy, as well as Amoonguss and Incineroar with Tera Dragon Dragon Energy. Tera Ghost provides Regidrago with a Fake Out immunity, helping in its hyper-aggressive gameplan; it also has the extra benefit of removing its weaknesses.

Regidrago's biggest weakness is Fairy-types such as Flutter Mane and Zacian-C, as well as Tera Fairy Pokemon like Calyrex-S and Raging Bolt. Faster Pokemon like Miraidon, Koraidon, and Chien-Pao are other huge threats for Regidrago because they can outspeed and OHKO it. Zacian-C is a great partner for Regidrago, utilizing its typing to threaten Fairy-types. Terapagos is another good partner Restricted Pokemon, being an alternative spread move attacker that can punish opposing Tera Fairy Pokemon that Regidrago would struggle against. Tailwind setters like Tornadus and Whimsicott cover for Regidrago's middling Speed tier and provide it with the ability to outspeed faster threats, drastically increasing its snowball potential. Indeedee-F and Farigiraf are other great partners, blocking priority moves like Fake Out and Sucker Punch with their abilities, setting up Trick Room to help against certain matchups like opposing Tailwind teams, and using Helping Hand to make Regidrago stronger. Indeedee-F is especially helpful thanks to its access to Follow Me, providing redirection support for Regidrago.

Dragon Fang.description:
*Draco Meteor allows Regidrago to pick OHKOs when Dragon Energy isn't dealing much damage at low HP, and Earth Power allows it to damage to Steel types like Gholdengo and Kingambit.

*Regidrago boosts its damage output with Dragon Fang that stacks on Dragon Maw and does insane damage.

*Tera Steel is a great defensive Tera that allows it to resist its original weaknesses.

Bulky Trick Room Sweeper.description:
Calyrex-I utilizes its high bulk and Attack, combined with its spread move Glacial Lance, to be a strong bulky attacker. Calyrex-I can spiral out of control quickly thanks to Chilling Neigh Attack boosts, while its access to Trick Room and low Speed stat allow it to operate as both a Trick Room setter and sweeper. Calyrex-I runs High Horsepower for coverage, letting it hit Fire- and Steel-types that resist Glacial Lance, such as Incineroar and Gholdengo. Calyrex-I runs Clear Amulet for an immunity to Intimidate and Incineroar's Parting Shot. Tera Fire will give it an immunity to Will-O-Wisp and improve its match up into Gholdengo. Tera Water grants Calyrex-I a better match up into both Kyogre and Gholdengo, while Tera Grass provides an immunity to Spore and Rage Powder from Amoonguss along with a stronger match up into Kyogre. The allocated EV spread allows Calyrex-I to survive an Electro Drift from Choice Specs Miraidon, while the allocated Attack allows Calyrex-I to OHKO Rillaboom.

Calyrex-I pairs well with Fake Out users and redirection support, which can allow it to set up Trick Room more easily, such as Incineroar and Amoonguss. Amoonguss is an especially strong partner, as the Grass-types that are immune to Spore are weak to Glacial Lance. Amoonguss can use Spore and Rage Powder against Zamazenta, which can otherwise set up Iron Defense and wall Calyrex-I, and use Spore and offer Pollen Puff recovery against Kyogre, which otherwise has a favourable damage trade against Calyrex-I. Calyrex-I also pairs well with Pelipper, as the rain reduces damage from Fire-type attacks, and it provides Wide Guard support, which can protect it against Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage and Kyogre's Water Spout. Non-Tera Grass Calyrex-I will struggle against Amoonguss, as it can underspeed it in Trick Room and use Spore, while non-Tera Fire variants will be vulnerable to Incineroar's Will-O-Wisp.

Bulky Setup.description:
Calyrex-S excels as a setup sweeper thanks to Astral Barrage and As One providing it with the potential to snowball. Calyrex-S has good matchups into threats such as Calyrex-I and Iron Defense Zamazenta-C. Draining Kiss hits Dark-types that resist Astral Barrage such as Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S and is a consistent form of recovery allowing Calyrex-S to stay on the field for longer. Nasty Plot is used to allow Calyrex-S to set up its offenses more quickly, while Calm Mind can help against threats such as Miraidon and Terapagos. Spell Tag allows Calyrex-S to OHKO Flutter Mane, while Covert Cloak prevents the stat drops from common stat-reducing spread moves such as Electroweb, Icy Wind, and Snarl, and it gives Calyrex-S an immunity to Fake Out after Terastallizing. Sitrus Berry is used for longevity and to allow Calyrex-S to stick on the field for longer. The EV spread allows Calyrex-S to survive Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R in rain, Volt Switch from Miraidon, and after Terastallization, Gholdengo's Make It Rain. The Speed EVs with a Timid nature let Calyrex-S outspeed base 135 Pokemon like Koraidon and Flutter Mane. The HP EVs are optimized for using a Sitrus Berry. Tera Fairy is used to give Calyrex-S a resistance to Dark-type moves such as Knock Off from Incineroar and Dark Pulse from Chi-Yu as well as a STAB boost to Draining Kiss while also being a good neutral defensive typing.

Incineroar and Terapagos are major checks to Calyrex-S, since both of them resist or have an immunity to Astral Barrage without being vulnerable to Draining Kiss. Urshifu-R helps massively with both of them, since Surging Strikes and Close Combat, respectively, threaten them. Clefairy protects Calyrex-S thanks to Friend Guard and Follow Me while also helping against Calyrex-I under Trick Room thanks to After You. Incineroar and Rillaboom offer Fake Out support for Calyrex-S while also increasing its survivability with Intimidate and Grassy Terrain healing, respectively, making it easier for Calyrex-S to set up. Incineroar can also help against opposing Calyrex-S and Calyrex-I, while Rillaboom can help against Miraidon and Kyogre, as the latter two can deal massive damage to Calyrex-S while in Tailwind with Electro Drift and Water Spout, respectively. Raging Bolt can help against threats such as Wide Guard Pelipper, which can prevent Calyrex-S from sweeping, while also providing speed control with Electroweb. Tornadus can offer speed control with Tailwind, which can help against opposing Tailwind teams, and it can set up rain with Rain Dance, helping against Koraidon.

Glass Cannon.description:
Calyrex-S is used as a nuke, getting OHKOs left and right with its high Speed and Special Attack paired with its powerful Astral Barrage, which allows it to snowball quickly and sweep unprepared teams thanks to As One. It has generally good matchups into teams centered around Zamazenta-C and Calyrex-I, since it is immune to Zamazenta-C's main attacking move and hits Calyrex-I for super effective damage. Expanding Force is used as strong spread damage when paired with Indeedee-F, with Psychic and Psyshock being alternatives when not running Indeedee-F; Psyshock, in particular, hits Assault Vest Pokemon and Calm Mind Terapagos harder at the cost of base damage. Pollen Puff is used for threats such as Rillaboom and Tera Grass Calyrex-I, since it hits both super effectively and with a Helping Hand boost, can KO Rillaboom. Shadow Ball is used on Choice Specs variants to avoid Wide Guard, while Protect is used on Life Orb variants. Choice Specs is used to maximize damage, while Life Orb trades power for flexibility. The defensive investment allows Calyrex-S to always survive a Tera Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and the Special Attack investment allows Choice Specs variants to almost always secure the OHKO with Astral Barrage onto Calyrex-I. Tera Ghost is used to maximize the power of Astral Barrage.

Strong priority moves and Pokemon that are faster than Calyrex-S can be huge threats to it, since it is frail and can be taken out easily. Tornadus and Indeedee-F are strong partners for Calyrex-S, with Tornadus providing Tailwind support and Indeede-F enabling it with Follow Me and Helping Hand, blocking opposing Sucker Punch from Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S, and reversing Trick Room for Calyrex-S. Pokemon that can take an attack from Calyrex-S, such as Incineroar, Chi-Yu, and Assault Vest Raging Bolt and Iron Hands, are also checks to Calyrex-S, since they can retaliate with powerful attacks of their own, while the former two can OHKO it with super effective Dark-type moves. Urshifu-S is also a good partner for Calyrex-S, since it can help against opposing Dark-and Normal-types such as Chi-Yu and Farigiraf, and it can help against opposing Calyrex-S, which can be problematic.

Focus Sash.description:
Calyrex-S is the number one threat in the Regulation G metagame, boasting an immensely powerful Astral Barrage off its phenomenal Special Attack and Speed that 2HKOes most of the metagame. Its access to Nasty Plot, shooting up its Special Attack to astronomical levels, in conjunction with its ability to hit most Pokemon for neutral or super effective damage like Rillaboom and Calyrex-I make it a Pokemon that every team needs to be more than adequately prepared for. Calyrex-S's Ghost typing crucially allows it to be immune to Fake Out from the likes of Incineroar and Rillaboom. Psyshock hits specially defensive Pokemon like Calm Mind Terapagos and Raging Bolt and those holding Assault Vest like Rillaboom hard. Psychic can be run instead to guarantee an OHKO on Urshifu-R, since Psyshock is a damage roll to do so. Alternatively, Draining Kiss lets Calyrex-S hit Dark-types such as Urshifu-S while maintaining longevity. Tera Blast can, however, be run over Draining Kiss in conjunction with Tera Fairy for higher power. Focus Sash ensures that Calyrex-S gets at least two attacks off thanks to its high Speed. Tera Ghost boosts Astral Barrage even further, leaving only Incineroar that can survive it at +2. Tera Fairy allows Calyrex-S to easily take Wicked Blow, Sucker Punch, and Knock Off from the likes of Urshifu-S, Chien-Pao, and Incineroar, respectively, while also powering up its own Fairy-type move of choice.

Calyrex-S, though highly oppressive with Astral Barrage alone, faces difficulty wearing down the ubiquitous Incineroar while also being completely unable to hit Terapagos with Astral Barrage. Urshifu-R helps Calyrex-S with this beautifully, threatening both of its mentioned checks and also boasting good matchups against other Dark-types in Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S. Incineroar and Rillaboom are also good allies as they provide Calyrex-S with Fake Out and recovery, letting it set up Nasty Plot more easily. Clefairy and Amoonguss are other good allies, as they redirect attacks away from Calyrex-S, allowing it to fire off Astral Barrage safely. The former also bolsters Calyrex-S's bulk with Friend Guard and can help it almost always move first even under Trick Room, thanks to After You; this is important because Calyrex-S is very vulnerable under the twisted dimensions. Amoonguss can heal it via Pollen Puff.

Ursaluna.overview:
• Ursaluna threatens OHKOs on most Pokemon with its Guts ability and access to a STAB combination that hits the entire metagame for neutral damage. Combined with a sleep immunity once Burned and low natural Speed, Ursaluna is a great Trick Room sweeper.

  • Ursaluna pairs exceptionally well with Trick Room setters like Indeedee-F and especially Cresselia. Indeedee-F supports it with Follow Me and Psychic Terrain, providing Ursaluna with a Fake Out immunity. Cresselia has excellent defensive synergy with Ursaluna and thanks to Levitate is immune to Ursaluna's Earthquake. It can also support Ursaluna with Lunar Blessing and Helping Hand.

  • One of Ursaluna's biggest weaknesses is ironically one of its strengths, Guts. Setting up may put Ursaluna at risk of damage or if using Protect, give up a turn of Trick Room and leave its partner vulnerable to being attacked twice. Since Ursaluna is a physical attacker, it is especially vulnerable to Fake Out and Intimidate cycling. A combination of Incineroar and Amoonguss is especially difficult for Ursaluna to deal with, as they can easily stall out Trick Room by constantly weakening Ursaluna, and Amoonguss also healing Incineroar with Pollen Puff. Ursaluna is also naturally weak to many Fake Out Pokemon, such as Rillaboom and Iron Hands, the former also halving Earthquakes damage thanks to setting up Grassy Terrain.

Guts Attacker.description:
• Facade and Headlong Rush are used as the strongest attacks available to Ursaluna. Earthquake is used as a strong spread damage option and to bypass Follow Me from opposing Ogerpon formes. Swords Dance can also be used to punish passive play and to reverse some of the effects from Intimidate, but this forces Ursaluna to give up one of its Ground-type moves.

  • The EV spread allows Ursaluna to survive Moonblast from Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane, Blood Moon from Life Orb Ursaluna-B, and Ivy Cudgel from Ogerpon-W, all after burn damage. The rest of the EVs are invested into Attack

  • Tera Ghost is used to give Ursaluna an immunity to Fighting-type attacks but more importantly Fake Out, removing a key method to stalling out Ursaluna's Trick Room turns. Tera Poison can be used for more resistances, notably improving the matchup against Rillaboom and Flutter Mane, which it normally struggles with; however, Ursaluna loses the Fake Out and Fighting immunity.

TailRoom Sweeper.description:
Ursaluna-B is a special attacking Trick Room sweeper with strong natural bulk and a STAB combination that can hit most Pokemon for neutral damage. With its part-Normal typing and Mind's Eye ability, it has a good matchup into Calyrex-S. It also does well against any Pokemon that cannot handle its STAB combination such as Urshifu-R, which has a high chance of being OHKOed by a Tera Normal Hyper Voice; Gholdengo, which is KOed by Earth Power; and Pokemon such as Ogerpon-H that are OHKOed by Blood Moon. Life Orb gives Ursaluna-B a consistent boost in damage output. Hyper Voice threatens both Pokemon on the opponent's field and helps steamroll games quickly if Ursaluna-B is not handled with. Blood Moon is also an option to hit a single foe for heavy damage. Ursaluna-B may opt for an EV spread of 244 Hp / 252 SpA / 12 SpD with a Quiet Nature and 0 Speed IVs to function best under Trick Room and minimize Life Orb recoil. Tera Normal increases Ursaluna-B's offensive pressure greatly, allowing for guaranteed OHKOs on Flutter Mane, Amoonguss, and Incineroar with Blood Moon as well as shedding many of its weaknesses.

Amoonguss counters Ursaluna-B, as it can outspeed Ursaluna-B and hit it with Spore in Trick Room. Ting-Lu can outspeed Ursaluna-B and slow its pace greatly thanks to Vessel of Ruin and Snarl. Farigiraf can prevent opposing Fake Out from stalling out Ursaluna-B, enable Ursaluna-B by setting Trick Room, and further boost Ursaluna-B's damage with Helping Hand. Miraidon prevents opposing Spore from affecting Ursaluna-B with Electric Terrain, and Ursaluna-B synergizes well with it due to its immunity to Discharge.

Trick Room Sweeper.description:
• Hyper Voice provides Ursaluna-B with a more spammable Normal-type STAB attack, especially during Blood Moon's cooldown.

  • Life Orb is recommended, as it provides Ursaluna-B with a boost to its attacks, and Ursaluna-B doesn't mind the recoil due to its great bulk and ability to consistently move first under Trick Room.

  • The given EV spread lets it live a Tera Fairy Moonblast from a Special Attack Booster Energy Flutter Mane. 0 Speed IVs and a Quiet nature allow it to function better under Trick Room.

  • Ursaluna-B may opt for an EV spread of 84 HP / 252 SpA / 172 Spe to outspeed Adamant Chien-Pao under Tailwind.

  • Tera Normal can be used to boost the damage output of Blood Moon and Hyper Voice to nuclear levels.

Glimmora.overview:
• Glimmora is a strong offensive threat with access to a good STAB combination and the powerful move Meteor Beam, which, when used with the Power Herb, can melt many targets, such as Assault Vest Entei and Incineroar. With Toxic Debris and signature move Mortal Spin, Glimmora can punish physical attackers and passive play, and, when combined with the threat of Meteor Beam, make it impossible to ignore while also requiring careful positioning to properly handle.

  • Glimmora has traditionally fit best on Dondozo teams, as the combination of Toxic Debris and Mortal Spin means your foes almost guaranteed to be afflicted with poison, putting your opponent on a timer. Assault Vest on Glimmora is especially effective on Dondozo teams, as the extra longevity helps it spread poison better and stall out even longer, making up for the lowered damage output.

  • With Meteor Beam, Glimmora can utilize its high Special Attack stat and good offensive typing as a damage dealer. Tornadus and Ogerpon-W are good partners; Tornadus provides speed control and can launch powerful Bleakwind Storms into Fighting-types that resist Meteor Beam and Ogerpon-W redirects potential Water- or Ground-type attacks while pressuring threats like Urshifu-R and Landorus. In return, Glimmora can threaten Grass-types, which resists both Ogerpon-W's STAB moves.

  • Glimmora's poor defensive typing, combined with its middling bulk and average Speed, makes Glimmora a glass cannon. Glimmora is weak to many prominent offensive threats such as Urshifu-R, Landorus, and Gholdengo. Glimmora also struggles to handle Rock-resistant foes such as Iron Hands, Kingambit, and Urshifu-R. Even then, many of these foes will concede Toxic Spikes while taking out Glimmora; for instance, Urshifu-R will set up both layers of Toxic Spikes if it attacks Glimmora. Amoonguss is another difficult match up, as it absords Toxic Spikes and takes Glimmora's attacks comfortably, while threatening a Spore.

Meteor Beam.description:
