Meteor Beam's power against most neutral targets is devastating. The Special Attack boost allows Glimmora to output offensive pressure with Sludge Bomb even after Power Herb is consumed.

  • Earth Power is used as coverage for the Steel-types that resist Glimmora's STAB combination. Energy Ball is also an option to utilize the Tera Grass STAB boost and to hit Pokemon that resist Meteor Beam such as Urshifu-R but makes it so that Steel-types resist all of Glimmora's attacks.

  • The Special Attack investment along with the Modest nature is necessary to pick up a OHKO on Landorus, Walking Wake, and Terastillized Urshifu-R with Meteor Beam. The OHKO on Landorus and Urshifu turns the match up against hyper offensive teams completely on its head, especially with speed control support from Tornadus.

  • The Defense investment is enough to guarantee surviving Rillaboom's Wood Hammer and a favourable roll of taking Kingambit's Iron Head. The Special Defensive investment lets it live Gholdengo's Make It Rain and Latias's Mist Ball. The rest of the EVs are invested into Speed, which allows Glimmora to outspeed Choice Scarf Landorus-T when in Tailwind.

  • Tera Grass has better synergy with Glimmora's original typing and provides an immunity to spore, but gives Glimmora weakness to common threats such as Chien-Pao. Tera Water, defensively, is a stronger neutral type into the metagame, but has fewer relevant resistances to common threats.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• Both Earth Power and Energy Ball are fine options, but Energy Ball can do more damage against neutral targets if Glimmora Terastallizes into a Grass type.

  • Mortal Spin is used as the final move for a more consistent method to spread poison than Toxic Debris.

  • The Assault Vest gives Glimmora much more longevity, as it allows it to comfortably tank special attacks while still dissuading physical attackers with the threat of Toxic Spikes. On teams where being able to spread poison is important, Assault Vest is a good option.

  • The special bulk allows Glimmora to live many strong super effective attacks, such as Choice Specs Gholdengo's Make It Rain; it also makes Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball a 3HKO. Glimmora still lives a Rillaboom Wood Hammer with the HP investment.

Dondozo.overview:
• Dondozo is a formidable threat thanks to its stats being doubled when combined with Tatsugiri's Commander ability. Due to its immense bulk, Dondozo is difficult to remove without adequate answers, easily sweeping through entire teams on its own.

  • Dondozo performs best with offensive threats that can break apart teams for it and still function independently without needing to pivot. Examples include Chien-Pao and Dragonite, as well as Tornadus and a sweeper such as Urshifu-S or Flutter Mane. The two cores utilize strong speed control and get off massive damage early, allowing Dondozo to clean up. Glimmora is another excellent partner, as its ability and signature move put foes on a timer, forcing them to burn through Dondozo before fainting to Toxic poison.

  • Dondozo struggles against Pokemon that can ignore its stat boosts, either by neutralizing or bypassing it entirely. Both Urshifu formes and Chien-Pao with Sacred Sword ignore Dondozo's Defense boost, with Chien-Pao both outspeeding and threatening Dondozo if it uses Tera Grass, and Urshifu-S dealing big damage with Wicked Blow and removing Dondozo's ability to stall with Protect. Incineroar and Gouging Fire are able to consistently weaken Dondozo with Breaking Swipe and Intimidate cycling respectively. A combination of Incineroar and Amoonguss is particularly difficult to handle, as Amoonguss can keep Incineroar safe with redirection and Incineroar is free to cycle Parting Shot and Intimidate.

  • Dondozo requires much more experience to properly play compared to other sweepers, due to only making plays with one Pokemon for most of the game. While its not impossible to play into certain difficult matchups, especially with a strong composition and much practice, it necessitates significant reads and good positioning of Dondozo to win.

Offensive Sweeper.description:
• Wave Crash is Dondozo's strongest Water-type move, OHKOing Pokemon like Tornadus and Gholdengo. Earthquake bypasses Follow Me from Ogerpon-W, and provides it a strong spread move thats picks off weakened foes.

  • Rocky Helmet breaks Focus Sash on Chien-Pao and Urshifu, allowing for an OHKO. It also allows for big damage on Urshifu-R using Surging Strikes. Leftovers allows Dondozo to recover swathes of health, even more so by stalling with Protect. However, its harder to use now, as most threats to Dondozo can outdamage Leftovers recovery, especially so considering the Urshifu formes ignore Protect. Clear Amulet can be used to remove ways to weaken Dondozo, primarily Incineroar and Gouging Fire.

  • 20 Defense EVs ensure that Sacred Sword from Chien-Pao is a 4HKO and allow Dondozo to survive two Wicked Blows from Urshifu-S. 76 Special Defense EVs allow Dondozo to survive two Moonblasts from Tera Fairy Choice Specs Flutter Mane. The Attack investment ensures Wave Crash OHKOes Urshifu-S after Rocky Helmet damage and that Order Up 2HKOes Ogerpon-W and Urshifu-R.

  • Tera Grass provides resistances to Grass- and Electric-type attacks, as well as giving an immunity to Spore from Amoonguss, which is otherwise difficult to deal with.

Supportive Yawn.description:
• Dondozo can utilize its strong natural bulk and typing to function as a supportive wall with Yawn.

  • Yawn Dondozo pairs best with Ting-Lu, as a combination of Sand Tomb and Yawn can reliably slow down foes and Ting-Lu's Vessel of Ruin helps with Dondozo's frailer Special Defense.

  • Dondozo struggles against Rillaboom and Amoonguss, as both resist Wave Crash, and it is harder to make damage over time stick with Grassy Terrain and Pollen Puff respectively. Additionally, the former threatens super effective damage on Dondozo and the latter threatens Spore.

  • Leftovers recovery gives Dondozo additional staying power in slower-paced battles compared to recovery Berries.

  • Oblivious prevents Dondozo from being shut down with Taunt from Pokémon such as Tornadus or affected by Intimidate from foes like Incineroar.

  • The invested bulk allows Dondozo to survive Thunderbolt from Raging Bolt, as well as surviving two Earth Powers from Landorus and OHKOing in return with Wave Crash. Heavy Slam is used to OHKO Flutter Mane.

Tatsugiri.overview: • Tatsugiri is solely used to combine with Dondozo, and shouldn't be picked outside of that purpose.

Choice Scarf Support.description:
• Icy Wind is used as a late-game speed control option. Dragon Pulse is a more consistent STAB move compared to Draco Meteor and Muddy Water, at the cost of damage. Sleep Talk allows Tatsugiri to better answer Amoonguss, while Tera Blast hits Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao in the rare circumstances where Tatsugiri is Terastallized.

  • Choice Scarf allows Tatsugiri to clean up late-game once Dondozo is down, either serving as speed control with Icy Wind to support its partner or dealing damage with Muddy Water and Draco Meteor.

  • The given EVs allow Tatsugiri to outspeed Choice Scarf Landorus-T and survive an Icicle Crash from Chien-Pao and a Wicked Blow from Urshifu-S.

  • Tera Steel gives Tatsugiri a resistance to Dragon and Fairy and a generally better defensive profile. Tera Water can be used to boost Muddy Water's damage and remove its weakness to Flutter Mane's Fairy-type STAB moves, which is useful in some end-game scenarios.

Choice Scarf.description:
Annihilape finds a good niche in the metagame, as it fares well against Pokemon such as Chi-Yu, Incineroar, and Zamazenta-C. Final Gambit deals immense damage if Annihilape cannot pick up an OHKO. Shadow Claw deals decent damage without needing to be hit like Rage Fist. Coaching has the ability to boost the power of allies like Calyrex-I, while U-turn helps with positioning, chipping Rillaboom in the process. Choice Scarf allows Annihilape to outspeed and deal damage to faster foes such as Calyrex-S, which faints to a Shadow Claw. Tera Grass allows it to ignore Spore and Rage Powder from Amoonguss, which can survive a Final Gambit and support its allies.

Choice Scarf Annihilape struggles against strong priority moves like Raging Bolt's Thunderclap and Rillaboom's Grassy Glide, which weaken Final Gambit. Farigiraf is also an issue, as it is a bulky Pokemon that is immune to Shadow Claw, deals great damage to Annihilape with Psychic, and has enough HP to survive a Final Gambit. Calyrex-I is a great partner for Annihilape, as Annihilape is able to either give it a Coaching boost or remove an annoying or powerful foe to Calyrex-I like Zamazenta-C or Calyrex-S with Final Gambit or Shadow Claw, respectively. In return, Calyrex-I is able to threaten Raging Bolt and Rillaboom for great damage. Smeargle is also a favorable partner, as it can redirect attacks away from Annihilape with Follow Me, allowing for a full-HP Final Gambit.

Bulky Support.description:
Farigiraf's main role is as a bulky support piece and Trick Room setter, and its ability to block priority is incredibly valuable in a format full of moves like Fake Out, Grassy Glide and Thunderclap. Due to its typing, it has a good matchup into Calyrex-S, as well as Psychic-type STAB moves are generally good into the metagame but especially into Amoonguss and Urshifu-R. Tera Blast is often seen in this slot, as both before and after Terastallization, it gives Farigiraf a consistent single-target STAB move. Foul Play is used to give Farigiraf a way to hit both Calyrex formes for super effective damage, being able to 2HKO both. Electric Seed is used in tandem with Miraidon, and gives Farigiraf more bulk, allowing it to stick around longer to support the team with Helping Hand and Armor Tail. Sitrus Berry allows Farigiraf to disrupt the opponent for longer than it would be able to without it. It can also help live some double-ups to help safely get Trick Room up, such as Surging Strikes + Knock Off from Urshifu-R and Incineroar, respectively. Safety Goggles is for if your team has a particularly bad matchup into Amoonguss and Farigiraf wants to be able to set up Trick Room without being put to sleep without Electric Terrain support from Miraidon. The HP and Special Defense EVs allow Farigiraf to live a Choice Specs Beads of Ruin single target Tera Starstorm from Terapagos, and the rest is put into Defense. Tera Ground is used next to Miraidon to allow it to freely use Discharge, and Tera Fairy allows it to resist the Dark- and Bug-type moves it'd otherwise be weak to like Knock Off and U-turn from Incineroar and Rillaboom, while also resisting Fighting-type attacks and gaining an immunity to Dragon-type moves, like Collision Course and Draco Meteor from Koraidon and Miraidon, respectively.

Farigiraf really doesn't like Restricted Pokemon that can OHKO it and potentially prevent Trick Room, such as Kyogre or Tera Fire Koraidon. It also struggles against fast Taunt users, such as Speed Booster Energy Flutter Mane, due to them being able to prevent Trick Room from going up, and bulky Dark-types like Incineroar, as Farigiraf can't hit them very hard without Tera Ground. Incineroar in particular can force a Tera with Knock Off. Miraidon and Farigiraf are great partners for each other, as Farigiraf stops Miraidon from being interrupted by Fake Out, which is particularly important for the Choice Specs set and Miraidon can activate the Electric Seed, making Farigiraf even bulkier, and as previously mentioned, Farigiraf can even Tera Ground so Miraidon can freely click Discharge next to it while the Electric Terrain makes Farigiraf immune to Amoonguss's Spore. Farigiraf itself benefits from partners that can help it set Trick Room, such as bulky Fake Out users like Incineroar and Rillaboom, as well as redirectors like Amoonguss and the Ogerpon formes. Trick Room sweepers also like having Farigiraf as a partner; for example, Calyrex-I loves the boost from Helping Hand, and so does Ursaluna-B. Another great partner is Iron Hands on the aforementioned Miraidon teams, as Farigiraf enjoys having a Fake Out user as a partner, and its Helping Hand lets Iron Hands do insane levels of damage with Quark Drive.

Throat Spray.description:
Farigiraf functions well as a supportive and offensive Pokemon. After a Throat Spray boost, Psychic OHKOes Amoonguss and 2HKOs Flutter Mane. Twin Beam reliably OHKOes Focus Sash and Psychic-weak Pokemon like Urshifu-R and Mienshao. Hyper Voice deals consistent damage and activates Throat Spray. The EV spread allows Farigiraf to survive Adamant Koraidon’s Flare Blitz and Kyogre’s Water Spout. Throat Spray powers up Farigiraf's already powerful attacks after a Hyper Voice. This allows it to then pick up KOs on foes like Koraidon. Tera Fairy is used on Farigiraf to resist powerful super effective attacks from Dark-types like Urshifu-S and Chi-Yu along with Fairy being a great neutral type in the metagame. Tera Normal sheds Farigiraf's Dark weakness and allows it to deal massive damage with Hyper Voice, 2HKOing on Pokemon like Miraidon and Clefairy.

Farigiraf has to be careful of powerful Dark-type attacks from Chi-Yu and Incineroar. A great partner for Farigiraf is Kyogre because it appreciates Farigiraf blocking powerful Grassy Glides and Thunderclaps as well as Fake Out. Other Pokemon like Incineroar and Rillaboom are also great partners, as they offer Fake Out support, allowing Farigiraf to set up Trick Room and, through Hyper Voice, Throat Spray. Urshifu-R is another amazing partner because it can hit the annoying Steel- and Dark-types that keep Farigiraf in check while also synergizing well with the aforementioned partners. It also appreciates Farigiraf's nullification of Fake Out, Thunderclap, and Grassy Glide as well as it removing Amoonguss.

Offensive.description:
• Hyper Voice activates Throat Spray to inflict a lot of damage and boost subsequent Psychics. Psyshock deals less damage than Psychic overall, but it allows Farigiraf to hit Flutter Mane and Assault Vest Pokemon like Rillaboom harder.

  • Throat Spray allows Farigiraf to put really good amounts of pressure unlike other Trick Room setters. Life Orb allows for more immediate damage and more pivoting ability, as you wont lose the damage boost when switching out, but provides less damage overall.

  • The HP and Special Defense EVs allow Farigiraf to survive Tera Fairy Moonblast from Choice Specs Flutter Mane, Tera Normal Helping Hand-boosted Hyper Voice from Life Orb Ursaluna-B, as well as non-Tera Life Orb Blood Moon. The heavy amount of Special Attack investment allows Farigiraf to serve its role as an offensive Pokemon very well, especially after a Throat Spray boost. The Defense investment allows Farigiraf to take Surging Strikes from Tera Water Choice Scarf Urshifu-R.

Kingambit.overview:
• Kingambit's strong stat line, good typing, and Defiant allow it to shine as an Intimidate counter and general offensive threat. It can function at any Speed tier thanks to Sucker Punch making up for its low Speed. It is flexible against many match ups thanks to its huge bulk and ability to exert huge amounts of pressure after a Swords Dance.

  • Gouging Fire is a fantastic partner for Kingambit, as it can boost its attack with Howl and keep it up on the field longer by reducing opponent's Attack with Breaking Swipe, with Kingambit shielding it from intimidate in return. Physical attackers such as Rillaboom, Ogerpon-W, and Chien-Pao all appreciate Kingambit warding off Intimidate users, with the former two providing Fake Out and Follow Me support, respectively, helping Kingambit set up a Swords Dance, and the latter boosting its damage with Sword of Ruin.

  • Since Kingambit usually only runs Dark-type attacks, it struggles against Pokemon that resist it, such as the Urshifu formes and Incineroar, the latter of which matches up well against Kingambit even when boosting its Attack thanks to resisting both of its STAB types. It also has problems with Amoonguss, since it can redirect Sucker Punch with rage powder and put it to sleep quite easily, while Kingambit cannot threaten it much in return. Raging Bolt can outspeed it and use Thunderclap to attack before Sucker Punch while taking Kowtow Cleave very well, especially since most sets run Tera Fairy.

Offensive.description:
• Swords Dance significantly raises the pressure Kingambit exerts, allowing it to deal significant damage even against resisted targets. However, Iron Head can be used to cover for Fairy-types such as Flutter Mane.

  • Black Glasses provides extra damage, allowing for an OHKO on Flutter Mane at +1 with Sucker Punch; Safety Goggles, however, gives Kingambit a better match-up against Amoonguss.

  • Tera Dragon is chosen to grant resistances to the Ogerpon formes' STAB attacks and other metagame threats that resist Dark, such as Urshifu-R and Chi-Yu. Tera Fairy is also a strong option as a neutral typing, and it also allows Kingambit to wall Urshifu-S and other Fighting-types.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• The given EV spread allows Kingambit to survive Life Orb Ursaluna-B's Earth Power or an Ivy Cudgel from Ogerpon-H as well as avoid the 3HKO from Raging Bolt's Thunderbolt. The Speed investment allows Kingambit to outspeed Landorus in tailwind.

  • Low Kick allows Kingambit to threaten Dark-Types such as Incineroar and opposing Kingambit; however, Tera Blast can also be used to cover for Dark- and Fighting-Types at the cost of needing to Terastallize.

Assault Vest.description:
Kingambit is a slow attacker that uses its good bulk and typing to tank hits from Pokemon like Calyrex-S, Lunala, and Terapagos, then respond with Dark- and Steel-type STAB attacks. Sucker Punch gives Kingambit a priority attack that it can use to get around its low Speed and that threatens Pokemon like the Calyrex formes. Tera Blast pairs with Tera Fairy to hit the Pokemon that wall Kingambit such as Urshifu-R and Iron Hands as well as Pokemon like Miraidon and Urshifu-S, while Low Kick is used to hit Pokemon that resist Steel- and Dark-type attacks such as Incineroar and Zamazenta-C. Assault Vest lets it survive attacks like Mystic Water Kyogre's Water Spout as well as getting 4HKOed by Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage most of the time. Tera Fairy gives Kingambit a resistance to Fighting-type attacks in addition to being a good defensive type that is neutral to most of the metagame.

Kingambit struggles into bulky Pokemon like Amoonguss and Incineroar that can easily survive an attack and respond with status moves like Will-O-Wisp or Spore. Offensive partners like Ursaluna-B and Miraidon help with this by threatening to OHKO Amoonguss and Incineroar, allowing Kingambit to clean up an endgame with Sucker Punch. Urshifu-R is another check for Kingambit, as it resists Kingambit's STAB attacks and can threaten it with Close Combat. Miraidon can threaten Pokemon like Mienshao and the Urshifu formes that threaten Kingambit. Miraidon also has the added benefit of blocking Spore from Amoonguss with Electric Terrain, which allows Kingambit to play more offensively. Calyrex-S is a good partner for Kingambit, as it appreciates Kingambit helping into opposing Calyrex-S and opposing Incineroar while Calyrex-S can threaten the Fighting-types that Kingambit struggles with like Mienshao. Calyrex-I can set Trick Room that Kingambit works well in while Calyrex-I threatens Amoonguss. Farigiraf is a good partner for Kingambit, as it prevents Fake Out and can set Trick Room for Kingambit while Incineroar, a Pokemon Farigiraf struggles with, doesn't want to switch into Kingambit and give it a Defiant boost.

Bulky Disruption.description:
Scream Tail is a bulky support Pokemon that uses its high Speed and disruption moves to punish opponents that hamper setup from Scream Tail's teammates. Encore allows Scream Tail to lock foes into passive moves such as Protect, Fake Out, and Taunt, giving its teammates opportunities to setup or attack as well as discouraging opponents from using the latter two moves to hinder setup. Disable is used similarly but can instead prevent opponents from going for attacks that would hit Scream Tail or its partners for large amounts of damage; Encore also disables moves that Pokemon are forced to use, either through Choice items or Scream Tail using Encore. Dazzling Gleam and Play Rough give Scream Tail a way to deal chip damage: Dazzling Gleam can bypass redirection from Pokemon like Amoonguss, while Play Rough can hit Pokemon such as Pelipper that use Wide Guard; both also potentially break a Focus Sash. Booster Energy allows Scream Tail to outspeed Pokemon like Calyrex-S and Choice Scarf Urshifu-R and threaten to use Disable and Encore. The Special Defense EVs allow Scream Tail to survive Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage or a Shadow Ball from Choice Specs Flutter Mane, while the Defense EVs let Scream Tail almost always survive one Wood Hammer from Choice Band Rillaboom. The Speed EVs let Scream Tail outspeed Adamant Choice Scarf Urshifu as well as Calyrex-S. Tera Grass allows Scream Tail to become immune to Spore and Rage Powder from Amoonguss.

Scream Tail partners well with Terapagos because it is a bulky setup sweeper that benefits from Scream Tail slowing down the pace of the game and discouraging opponents from using Fake Out, Taunt, and other moves that would prevent it from setting up Calm Mind. Raging Bolt, Rillaboom, and Incineroar are strong with Scream Tail, as it discourages opponents from using Protect in front of Protect, Grassy Glide, and Fake Out, respectively. Scream Tail struggles against Pokemon that carry Taunt, such as Incineroar and Tornadus, as they make it functionally useless and force Scream Tail to switch out, burning its Booster Energy. It is also extremely passive and reliant on its teammates to cover for its lack of damage output.

Support.description:
• Booster Energy allows Scream Tail to outspeed most of the metagame and launch fast Encores and Disables.

  • Dazzling Gleam is used to chip low health targets. Disable and Encore are great supportive tools to disrupt foes and can punish passive play.

  • The EV spread allows it to survive Choice Specs Flutter Mane Shadow Ball while comfortably taking a Tera Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and Tera Dark Wicked Blow from Urshifu-S.

  • Tera Dark is preferred for Prankster Taunt immunity and a Ghost resistance. Alternatively, Tera Grass can be used to provide immunity to powder moves from Amoonguss.

Offensive Speed Control.description:
Flutter Mane's excellent Ghost Fairy typing that offers an immunity to Fake Out, its Protosynthesis ability and Booster Energy allowing it to gain a Speed boost, and its vast movepool including speed reducing moves such as Icy Wind and Thunder Wave help Flutter Mane function as an excellent speed control Pokemon in Regulation G. Flutter Mane is especially effective against Pokemon that rely on their speed, such as Choice Scarf Urshifu-R and Calyrex-S, as it can threaten to OHKO or slow them down before they move. Taunt can be used instead of Shadow Ball to shut down support Pokemon like Amoonguss and Clefairy, as well as prevent Terapagos from setting up. Flutter Mane can also opt for Thunder Wave to reduce the Speed of Clear Amulet and Covert Cloak Pokemon such as Koraidon and Calyrex-S. Icy Wind is mandatory for Flutter Mane to play as speed control, slowing down both opposing Pokemon while also breaking Focus Sash from the likes of Chien-Pao and the Urshifu formes. Booster Energy allows Flutter Mane to outspeed the entire metagame and become a stronger form of speed control. The EV spread enables Flutter Mane to survive strong physical attacks such as Calyrex-I's Glacial Lance, Adamant Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash, and almost always Adamant Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes. The Special Defense lets it take Volt Switch from Modest Choice Specs Miraidon and Blood Moon from Ursaluna-B. Meanwhile, the Speed investment lets Flutter Mane outspeed neutral nature base 135 Speed Pokemon like Miraidon and Chien-Pao. Tera Fairy is great on Flutter Mane to shed its weakness to Ghost-type attacks such as Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S and boost its damage output, allowing Flutter Mane to threaten a potential OHKO on Miraidon and ensure a 2HKO on Raging Bolt.

Flutter Mane struggles against bulky physical attackers like Assault Vest Rillaboom and Iron Hands, which can sponge its attacks, don't mind becoming slower, and threaten an OHKO in return. Zacian-C and Zamazenta-C are major issues in a similar way, but they don't enjoy having their Speed reduced. Flutter Mane also struggles to keep up with more immediate speed control, specifically Prankster Tailwind from Tornadus and Whimsicott, that may allow slower Pokemon like Urshifu-R and Miraidon to threaten it. Flutter Mane pairs well with a variety of Pokemon, namely offensive Pokemon that can utilize its speed control. Chi-Yu exploits this especially well, threatening Zacian-C, Zamazenta-C, and Rillaboom with Heat Wave and Overheat. Chi-Yu also makes up for Flutter Mane's lack of offensive investment with Beads of Ruin and appreciates Flutter Mane's ability to threaten Dragon-types. Choice Specs Terapagos is an excellent asset for this duo, as it takes advantage of how often Flutter Mane and Chi-Yu can force Terastallization. Zamazenta-C can protect Flutter Mane from threatening spread moves such as Astral Barrage and Glacial Lance from the Calyrex formes. Terapagos and Zamazenta-C also appreciate Flutter Mane's speed control making up for their mediocre speed tiers, and its Fairy typing that threatens Koraidon.

Glass Cannon.description:
Flutter Mane is a supportive special attacker that functions well on sun teams. Since Flutter Mane is immune to Fake Out, it can ignore the threat of Fake Out to use Taunt on Pokemon such as Calyrex-I or Amoonguss as well as being able to attack without having to fear the chip damage that the move does. Flutter Mane can use support moves such as Taunt over Shadow Ball to prevent opposing Pokemon like Calyrex-I or Amoonguss from setting Trick Room or using moves like Spore, respectively. When paired with Pokemon that set sun such as Koraidon or Groudon, Flutter Mane can use Protosynthesis to boost its Speed and use Icy Wind as a form of speed control, outspeeding and slowing down Pokemon such as Calyrex-S. Dazzling Gleam gives Flutter Mane a spread option that it can boost with Terastallization. Focus Sash lets Flutter Mane live a hit without needing to invest EVs in bulk. Tera Fairy and Stellar both allow Flutter Mane to OHKO Raging Bolt; Tera Stellar allows Shadow Ball to pick up KOs like those against all opposing Flutter Mane. However, Tera Fairy is more consistent, since it can use Fairy-type STAB moves without worrying about losing the boost.

Choice Scarf Urshifu-R threatens Flutter Mane when paired with Pokemon such as Tornadus or Pelipper that can set rain for it, removing both Flutter Mane's Speed boost and the sun. Assault Vest Rillaboom can take Flutter Mane's attacks, threaten it with Wood Hammer, and finish it off on the subsequent turn with Grassy Glide. Flutter Mane pairs well with Pokemon that can redirect attacks away from it such as Ogerpon and Amoonguss, since this allows it to maintain its Focus Sash and stay on the field longer. In addition to redirecting attacks, Amoonguss matches up well into Urshifu-R. Raging Bolt can remove Pokemon such as Urshifu-R that threaten Flutter Mane while also reliably switching into Rillaboom's Wood Hammer and Grassy Glide. Chi-Yu also benefits from Icy Wind speed control and threatens Rillaboom while also boosting Flutter Mane's damage with Beads of Ruin.

Choice Specs.description:
Flutter Mane works well as an offensive threat due to its great offensive typing and Speed, allowing it to outspeed most of the metagame and do notable damage to Pokemon like Koraidon, Miraidon, and both Calyrex and Urshifu formes. Shadow Ball and Moonblast are strong STAB moves, and Dazzling Gleam provides strong spread damage. Power Gem provides good coverage for Fire-type Pokemon like Incineroar and Ogerpon-H, Taunt is a good way to shut down support Pokemon like Amoonguss and Farigiraf, and Icy Wind is great speed control. Choice Specs increases Flutter Mane's offense even further, as it can OHKO Pokemon such as Assault Vest Raging Bolt. The EV spread allows Flutter Mane to outspeed Chien-Pao, Koraidon, and Miraidon without Speed-boosting natures and live an Ice Spinner from Adamant Chien-Pao. Tera Fairy is great both offensively and defensively, as Flutter Mane could output more damage, resist Dark-type moves from the likes of Chien-Pao and Urshifu, and give Flutter Mane a neutrality to Ghost, allowing it to survive an Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S.

Pokemon that can outspeed and OHKO Flutter Mane, like Choice Scarf Urshifu-R and Calyrex-S, and Pokemon that can survive Flutter Mane STAB moves like Amoonguss are good checks to Flutter Mane. Flutter Mane's physical fraility is also a huge weakness, mostly fainting against a plethora of physical moves. Incineroar is a good teammate for Flutter Mane, as Intimidate can help Flutter Mane shore up its poor Defense while also having a resistance against Dark- and Ghost-type moves. Pokemon with the ability to set up the sun like Groudon and Koraidon are also good teammates for Flutter Mane, as it allows Protosynthesis to activate and heighten Flutter Mane's Speed stat.

Offensive.description:
• Flutter Mane is an effective cleaner thanks to Moonblast, which is its strongest STAB move, and Dazzling Gleam, which provides spread damage.

  • Special Attack Booster Energy is Flutter Mane's strongest boosting item if it wants to keep Protect. Fairy Feather can be used instead, allowing it to retain its offensive boosts when switching at the cost of damage.

  • The EV spread is built to survive an Ice Spinner from Jolly Chien-Pao and to outspeed Tornadus, with the remaining EVs boosting Flutter Mane's Special Attack

  • Flutter Mane appreciates Tera Fairy to further boost its damage on Moonblast and Dazzling Gleam . This also removes its Ghost weakness and makes it resist Dark-type attacks, allowing it to better deal with opposing Flutter Mane and survive a potential Sucker Punch from Pokemon like Kingambit.

Speed-Boosting Support.description:
• Flutter Mane requires Icy Wind to accomplish its role as speed control, forcing it to pick between Dazzling Gleam and Moonblast.

  • Speed Booster Energy allows Flutter Mane to outspeed the majority of the metagame.

  • With Booster Energy, Flutter Mane can outspeed opposing Chien-Pao at -1 and Modest Gholdengo in Tailwind. The defensive investment lets it survive Adamant Chien-Pao's Ice Spinner and Gholdengo's Make It Rain.

  • Tera Fairy is appreciated to gain more of an offensive presence and helps against opposing Flutter Mane, as Speed Booster Energy Flutter Mane is unable to OHKO opposing Flutter Mane with Shadow Ball.

Iron Bundle.overview:
• Iron bundle is the fastest threat in Regulation F thanks to Booster Energy and is used as a speed control option. It can threaten Landorus, Ogerpon-W, Incineroar, and Urshifu-R with super effective damage and an OHKO on the former two.

  • Iron Bundle appreciates offensive Pokemon that take advantage of Icy Wind like Urshifu-S, Ogerpon-H, Choice Specs Flutter Mane, and Landorus. Flutter Mane and Landorus specifically threaten Kingambit and Urshifu for Iron Bundle.

  • Iron Bundle is weak to priority attackers like Rillaboom, Chien-Pao, Dragonite, and Raging Bolt, since they can ignore Iron Bundle's Speed and Icy Wind's Speed drops while still pressuring it for huge damage if not an OHKO because of its low defenses.

Glass Cannon.description:
• Icy Wind is used for speed control, Hydro Pump is used as the main Water-STAB move, and Freeze-Dry is preferred to threaten common Water-types like Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W.

  • Booster Energy is used to raise its Speed, which allows it to outspeed threats like Choice Scarf Urshifu-R, Booster Energy Flutter Mane, and Regidrago and Modest Landorus under Tailwind.

  • Tera Ghost is used for an immunity to threatening priority moves like Fake Out and Extreme Speed.

Bulky Attacker.description:
Iron Hands functions as a bulky attacker and pivot that provides support options such as Fake Out, and its STAB moves can handle prominent metagame staples like Incineroar and Urshifu formes. Iron Hands has a solid matchup against opposing Miraidon teams, as it is one of the few Pokemon capable of surviving a Hadron Engine-boosted Draco Meteor from Choice Specs Miraidon. In addition to that, Iron Hands matches up well against Terapagos and threatens it with Drain Punch. It also helps deal with Calyrex-I Trick Room teams by providing Fake Out support and utilizing its low speed to outspeed and KO Incineroar in Trick Room as well as trade decently with Calyrex-I in Electric Terrain by utilizing its Tera. Wild Charge is used over Thunder Punch, as it OHKOes Urshifu-R and, in Electric Terrain, 2HKOes Calyrex-I. The recoil damage can be compensated through Drain Punch recovery. Close Combat can be used on more offensively oriented teams to get some quick OHKOs on the likes of Incineroar, and Terapagos in Electric Terrain. Volt Switch is used so Iron Hands can be a slow pivot, which helps as a positioning tool. Ice Punch provides a way to 2HKO Amoonguss and Raging Bolt as well as OHKO the occasional Landorus. Meanwhile, Heavy Slam functions as a way to get quick KOs against the likes of Flutter Mane and Tera Fairy Calyrex-S outside of Electric Terrain. Assault Vest boosts Iron Hands's mediocre Special Defense stat. The defensive investment helps Iron Hands survive two Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R as well as two Body Presses from Zamazenta-C. Iron Hands's Special Defense is maximized to take full advantage of Assault Vest, while the Speed investment allows Iron Hands to outspeed Regidrago under Tailwind. The Attack EVs, meanwhile, ensure Quark Drive boosts its Attack stat even after an Intimidate. Tera Grass can be used to gain immunity to Spore and Rage Powder as well as a resistance to Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes and Landorus's Earth Power, whereas Tera Water gives Iron Hands an excellent defensive typing, allowing it to resist Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and Glacial Lance from Calyrex-I. Tera Fairy is a solid defensive typing that is neutral into most of the metagame. Its immunity to Dragon helps as well when facing Miraidon and Regidrago.

Iron Hands is particularly weak to faster setup teams, with foes like Tera Grass Clefairy and Amoonguss that can take hits from Iron Hands and redirect its moves, allowing Calyrex-S to set up with Nasty Plot. Ground-type Pokemon such as Landorus and Groudon can wall Iron Hands and threaten to 2HKO it. As a physical attacker, Iron Hands naturally struggles against Intimidate users like Incineroar as well as Defense-boosting Pokemon like Zamazenta-C that can set up Iron Defense, essentially walling Iron Hands. Miraidon naturally complements Iron Hands thanks to its Hadron Engine, as well as functioning as a fast offensive attacker capable of OHKOing all of the aforementioned checks. Meanwhile, a Trick Room setter such as Farigiraf provides excellent speed control to take advantage of Iron Hands's mediocre Speed tier. Farigiraf prevents any opposing Pokemon from using Fake Out thanks to Armor Tail while also having access to Helping Hand, which further boosts Iron Hands's offensive capabilities. Slower powerhouses like Ursaluna-B complement Iron Hands by threatening Incineroar and Zamazenta-C, as well as forming a solid Trick Room core with Farigiraf. Pokemon that fit well on a slower playstyle like Incineroar and Amoonguss also work well with Iron Hands by providing Fake Out, Intimidate, redirection and recovery to form a well-rounded balance core.

Offensive Pivot.description:
• Drain Punch is used, as Assault Vest Iron Hands wants to keep staying on the field, Wild Charge is used as the most consistent Electric-Type STAB move, and finally Heavy Slam is used as coverage for Flutter Mane and as a strong neutral option.

  • The 252 Special Defense EVs are used to minimize the damage taken from threatening special attacks like Earth Power from Landorus or Moonblast from Flutter Mane. The Speed EVs are used to outspeed the Urshifu formes and Adamant Ogerpon formes in Tailwind.

  • Assault Vest helps Iron Hands's low Special bulk and allows it to take super effective hits better.

  • Tera Grass is used to resist moves from Electric-resistant Ground- and Grass-type foes such as Landorus, Rillaboom, and Ogerpon-W while also providing a powder move immunity from Amoonguss. Tera Fire can also be used to resist Fairy- and Fire-type moves from Flutter Mane and Ogerpon-H; however, this keeps the weakness to Landorus as well as adding a Water-type weakness.

Booster Energy.description:
Iron Jugulis's combination of good support tools in Snarl and Tailwind, great offensive typing, and powerful Hurricane make it a versatile utility attacker that works well in rain. Snarl provides Iron Jugulis with a damage reduction option that not only supports its team but also gives it a favorable matchup against the likes of Calyrex-S and Terapagos. Hurricane's pairing with rain gives Iron Jugulis the ability to consistently threaten Pokemon like the Urshifu formes and Rillaboom. Tailwind is a strong speed control option to help support both itself and its teammates. The Speed investment along with Booster Energy allows Iron Jugulis to outspeed Choice Scarf Urshifu-R. The defensive investment allows Iron Jugulis to survive Flare Blitz from Koraidon in sun, Moonblast from non-Choice Specs Flutter Mane, and Thunderbolt from Assault Vest Raging Bolt. Tera Water provides Iron Jugulis with a better defensive typing against matchups like Calyrex-I and Urshifu-R.

Iron Jugulis typically struggles versus powerful Electric-types like Miraidon and Booster Energy Raging Bolt, both of which threaten to OHKO it. Urshifu-R can also be a somewhat problematic matchup, threatening huge damage under rain with Surging Strikes and forcing Iron Jugulis to Terastallize. Assault Vest Kyogre is Iron Jugulis's best partner, providing rain for its Hurricane and benefitting greatly from Iron Jugulis's Tailwind. Kyogre's superb special bulk allows it to become untouchable on the special side when paired with Snarl, and, with Tera Grass, it can reliably deal with Electric-type threats. Urshifu-R is another great partner, as both it and Iron Jugulis are strong weather abusers that appreciate weather control, with Iron Jugulis covering for the Grass-types that Urshifu-R typically struggles against. Urshifu-R is a great beneficiary of Tailwind, which allows it to fire off fast Surging Strikes next to Iron Jugulis to exert offensive pressure. Iron Jugulis also pairs well with Incineroar thanks to Intimidate + Snarl being a particularly strong damage-reducing combination to cover a multitude of threats alongside Fake Out, which allows Iron Jugulis to set up Tailwind safely.

Tailwind Support.description:
• Snarl is helpful to slow down the plethora of strong special attackers in the format.

  • Booster Energy allows Iron Jugulis to fire off fast attacks like Snarl into opposing special attackers and set up Tailwind more easily, as well as outspeed threats such as Chien-Pao.

  • The bulk allows Iron Jugulis to survive a Extreme Speed from Choice Band Tera Normal Dragonite with Sword of Ruin active, as well as an Icicle Crash from a -1 Attack Chien-Pao. After a Snarl, Iron Jugulis lives a Dazzling Gleam from Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane, as well as Thunderbolt from Raging Bolt.

  • Both Tera Poison and Steel are viable, but Poison is generally preferred thanks to the Fighting resistance and generally better synergy with Iron Jugulis's original type. In comparison, Tera Steel gives more resistances to powerful moves in the format like Blood Moon and Make It Rain, but it is weak to more types than Tera Poison.

Baxcalibur.overview:
• Baxcalibur's massive Attack stat, solid bulk, and STAB Ice-type moves allow it to apply immediate offensive pressure or set up to sweep. Landorus, Raging Bolt, Rillaboom, and Amoonguss fear its Ice-type STAB moves, and Incineroar and Ogerpon-W struggle to damage Baxcalibur, which opens up setup opportunities.

  • Incineroar, Rillaboom, Ogerpon-W, and Amoonguss are great teammates for Baxcalibur, providing Intimidate, Fake Out, Grassy Terrain, and redirection support to give it opportunities to set up Swords Dance and fire off its attacks. Baxcalibur also functions well on Pelipper + Archaludon rain teams, as it threatens Raging Bolt, Amoonguss, Landorus, and Rillaboom, all of which rain struggles against.

  • Steel-types like Kingambit and Gholdengo resist Baxcalibur's STAB attacks, which can hinder its ability to sweep or punch holes. In addition, the prevalence of Flutter Mane, Urshifu-R, and Urshifu-S can pressure it to Terastallize. Baxcalibur's low Speed can also make it struggle to keep up with offensive pressure from the opposing side.

Clear Amulet.description:
• With the given EV spread, Baxcalibur can outspeed -1 Landorus and survive Choice Band Wicked Blow from Urshifu-S, a Tera Stellar Sacred Sword from Chien-Pao, and a Dazzling Gleam from Choice Specs Flutter Mane.

  • Glaive Rush is Baxcalibur's best Dragon-type STAB because of its massive Base Power, with Protect offsetting the drawback. Ice Shard makes up for Baxcalibur's middling Speed tier and threatens Landorus. Icicle Crash is a good Ice-type STAB that has a chance to flinch the target. Swords Dance grants Baxcalibur a boosting move that makes it a more threatening Pokemon to the opposition.

  • Tera Poison grants Baxcalibur a to resistance Urshifu's Close Combat and Flutter Mane's Fairy-type moves while also being a great neutral type against the majority of the metagame.

  • Clear Amulet gives Baxcalibur an immunity to Intimidate from the likes of Incineroar and Hisuian-Arcanine. It also helps against Icy Wind from Flutter Mane and ElectroWeb from Assault Vest Raging Bolt.

  • Thermal Exchange prevents Baxcalibur from being burned by Wil-O-Wisp users like Incineroar in addition to deterring Ogerpon-H and Chi-Yu from using their Fire-type STAB moves.

Nasty Plot.description:
Nasty Plot Gholdengo is an amazing setup sweeper thanks to its excellent defensive typing, Make It Rain, and Good as Gold, which gives it an invaluable immunity to Spore from Amoonguss and Taunt. Gholdengo has good matchups into common Restricted Pokemon such as Calyrex-I and Zamazenta-C. Nasty Plot is used to allow Gholdengo to set up and sweep opposing teams. Leftovers gives Gholdengo more longevity, while Metal Coat is used so it can OHKO Flutter Mane with unboosted Make It Rain. The Special Attack investment allows Gholdengo to always 2HKO Zamazenta-C with +2 Shadow Ball, while the defensive investment allows Gholdengo to survive Origin Pulse from Mystic Water Kyogre and Flare Blitz from Incineroar. The Speed investment allows Gholdengo to outspeed Pelipper. Tera Normal is used to give Gholdengo an immunity to threatening Ghost-type moves such as Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S and Shadow Ball from Flutter Mane, while Tera Water is used because it is a good defensive typing overall while allowing Gholdengo to resist Fire-type attacks.

Common checks to Gholdengo consist of Incineroar, Chi-Yu, Assault Vest Raging Bolt, and Calyrex-S. Chi-Yu and Calyrex-S outspeed and threaten to OHKO Gholdengo. Assault Vest Raging Bolt easily shrugs off attacks from Gholdengo, while Incineroar walls it and can hit back with super effective Knock Off and Flare Blitz. Common partners for Gholdengo include Amoonguss, Incineroar, and Ogerpon-C, which help Gholdengo defensively by aiding in its setup with redirection and Pollen Puff healing as well as Fake Out and Intimidate, respectively. Urshifu-R and Pelipper are also great partners, as they can deal with Calyrex-S, Chi-Yu, and Incineroar thanks to Pelipper's combination of Drizzle, Wide Guard, and Weather Ball and Urshifu-R's ability to outspeed and threaten all three of them with Surging Strikes. Calyrex-I and Koraidon are strong Gholdengo partners, since Gholdengo can help deal with threats such as Zamazenta-C and Zacian-C and appreciates how the two threaten Incineroar. Koraidon especially appreciates Gholdengo, as it can take on Calyrex-I + Amoonguss teams incredibly well.

Choice Specs.description:
Gholdengo is a strong special attacker that uses its great ability to switch into moves like Amoonguss's Spore and Incineroar's Parting Shot, allowing it to attack without being slowed down. Gholdengo is also used as a check to Pokemon like Zamazenta-C and Zacian-C, since it walls them. Trick is used to cripple support and setup Pokemon like Amoonguss and Terapagos or force Pokemon that set Trick Room such as Calyrex-I to switch out. Nasty Plot gives Gholdengo the option to set up once it has used Trick. Power Gem hits Fire-types that resist Make It Rain such as Incineroar, Chi-Yu, and Ogerpon-H. Alternatively, Dazzling Gleam threatens Pokemon like Miraidon and Koraidon. Choice Specs allows Gholdengo to use its strong Steel- and Ghost-type attacks to immediately threaten Pokemon like Calyrex-I, especially if it uses Tera Steel. The EV spread allows Gholdengo to survive Choice Specs Miraidon's Volt Switch, Incineroar's Flare Blitz, and Kyogre's Mystic Water-boosted Origin Pulse and OHKO bulky Flutter Mane sets with Shadow Ball. The Speed EVs let it outspeed the Ogerpon formes when they are at -1. Tera Steel lets Gholdengo OHKO Landorus and Tera Fairy Assault Vest Raging Bolt, and if Gholdengo is paired with speed control providers such as Tailwind Tornadus and Icy Wind Flutter Mane, it can run it to boost Make It Rain even further. Tera Dragon allows Gholdengo to resist Fire-type attacks such as Koraidon's Flare Blitz and Groudon's Heat Crash as well as Miraidon's Electro Drift and Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes. Tera Water also lets Gholdengo resist Fire- and Water-type attacks like Kyogre's Water Spout and Koraidon's Flare Blitz while not making it weak to Ice- and Fairy-type attacks such as Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash and Flutter Mane's Moonblast.

Incineroar resists Gholdengo's STAB combination while threatening it with Flare Blitz and Knock Off. Chi-Yu similarly checks Gholdengo while also outspeeding and threatening an OHKO on it with Dark Pulse or Overheat. Assault Vest Raging Bolt resists Make It Rain and avoids the 2HKO from Shadow Ball. As for teammates, Gholdengo pairs well with Terapagos, since Gholdengo walls Zamazenta-C, while Terapagos matches up well against Calyrex-S and can switch into Ghost-type attacks. Gholdengo also pairs well with Calyrex-I, since it can check Zamazenta-C and Zacian-C, which Calyrex-I struggles with. Gholdengo additionally has great synergy with Pelipper due to rain reducing Gholdengo's weakness to Fire and Pelipper threatening Fire-types that resist Make It Rain such as Incineroar and Chi-Yu. Finally, Chien-Pao and Calyrex-I are both good partners for Gholdengo, since they can threaten Raging Bolt.

Glass Cannon.description:
Chien-Pao is a fast physical attacker that uses its good Speed tier and strong STAB attacks to threaten popular Pokemon like Koraidon, Miraidon, and Calyrex-S. Ice Spinner is used as a consistent Ice-type STAB move that can remove Terrains that Pokemon like Indeedee-F, Miraidon, and Rillaboom set up. Removing Psychic Terrain can allow Chien-Pao to threaten Calyrex-S with a super effective Sucker Punch. Alternatively, Icicle Crash hits less consistently, but it avoids Rocky Helmet damage, can cause foes to flinch, and keeps up Terrains that would benefit Chien-Pao. Sucker Punch gives Chien-Pao a priority option that can KO faster Pokemon such as Speed Booster Energy Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle. Sacred Sword allows Chien-Pao to hit Pokemon that resist its STAB moves like Incineroar and Zamazenta-C. Chien-Pao can run Throat Chop as a consistent Dark-type STAB attack that can hit Lunala and Calyrex-S even if they didn't use an attacking move. Throat Chop also prevents Incineroar from using Parting Shot. Focus Sash allows Chien-Pao to survive at least one attack and to give it the opportunity to use another move due to its high Speed. Chien-Pao can use Tera Ghost to become immune to Fighting while also avoiding priority attacks like Fake Out and Extreme Speed that would otherwise break its Focus Sash. Tera Stellar is a more offensive option that allows Chien-Pao to pick up KOs that it would otherwise miss out on like bulky Flutter Mane.

The best check for Chien-Pao is Incineroar, as it restists both STAB types and packs Intimidate. Zacian-C also resists Chien-Pao's STAB moves and threatens it with all of its attacks. Choice Scarf Urshifu-R and Flutter Mane can threaten to bring Chien-Pao down to Focus Sash or OHKO it, with the former resisting Chien-Pao's STAB combination and the latter also threatening to slow it down with Icy Wind. Chien-Pao pairs well with physical attackers like Zacian-C and Rillaboom, as Sword of Ruin makes them even more potent threats and they can handle Urshifu-R and Flutter Mane for Chien-Pao. However, they also struggle against Incineroar and opposing Zacian-C. This makes Urshifu-R and Zamazenta-C also good options for Chien-Pao, since they can threaten Incineroar and Zacian-C while taking advantage of Sword of Ruin. Chien-Pao can threaten Grass- and Dragon-types that resist Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes such as Rillaboom and Raging Bolt, as well as making quick work of Ghost-types that are immune to Body Press such as Calyrex-S.

Support.description:
Ting-Lu finds its niche as a bulky support Pokemon due to Vessel of Ruin, impressive defenses, and great natural typing. It is able to slow down powerful special attackers like Terapagos with Snarl and use its typing to have a positive matchup against Calyrex-S, Miraidon, and Raging Bolt. Ruination provides constant damage, while Throat Chop can threaten to OHKO Calyrex-S and prevent Parting Shot from Incineroar. Stomping Tantrum allows it to threaten Incineroar, Miraidon, and Raging Bolt. Heavy Slam is used on Assault Vest sets to threaten Fairy-type Pokemon like Flutter Mane and Tera Fairy Calyrex-S, whereas Protect sees play on Rocky Helmet sets. Assault Vest allows Ting-Lu to bolster its special bulk even more, making special attacks like Flutter Mane's Moonblast and Calyrex-S's Draining Kiss a 4HKO. Rocky Helmet threatens constant chip damage on Pokemon like Urshifu-R. The EV investment allows Ting-Lu to survive a Wood Hammer from Assault Vest Rillaboom and take two Moonblast from Speed Booster Energy Flutter Mane for the Rocky Helmet set. The Attack investment allows Ting-Lu to OHKO Flutter Mane with Heavy Slam and to 2HKO Raging Bolt and bulky Farigiraf with Stomping Tantrum and Throat Chop, respectively. Tera Poison is utilized to resist the Urshifu formes's Close Combat, Rillaboom's STAB moves, and Flutter Mane's Moonblast. Tera Fairy sees usage thanks to its defensive nature, allowing Ting-Lu to have great matchup into the Urshifu formes while also becoming immune to Draco Meteor from Raging Bolt and Miraidon.

Ting-Lu sees usage with Restricted Pokemon like Calyrex-I and Zamazenta-C, allowing both to benefit from Ting-Lu's special damage reduction capabilities. Calyrex-I appreciates Ruination chip and Ting-Lu benefits from Trick Room set by Calyrex-I, while Zamazenta-C provides Wide Guard support, improving the matchup against opposing Calyrex-I. Ting-Lu can be slowed down by Pokemon like Incineroar, which makes Ting-Lu passive by reducing its damage output significantly thanks to Intimidate. Zamazenta-C helps in this regard because it can OHKO Incineroar with Body Press. Koraidon, Zamazenta-C, and Calyrex-I have a great matchup into Ting-Lu and are able to remove it from the field without taking much damage from its STAB moves. Therefore, Pelipper proves to be a great partner for Ting-Lu, providing rain support and Wide Guard, which slow down Pokemon like Koraidon and Calyrex-I, and threatening great damage on Incineroar with Weather Ball. Ting-Lu struggles against strong super effective attacks from Pokemon like Rillaboom, Kyogre, and the Urshifu formes. Raging Bolt is a great partner to Ting-Lu, as it can threaten Urshifu-R and Kyogre for super effective damage and resist Grass-type STAB moves from Rillaboom. Incineroar and Amoonguss are a great duo that support Ting-Lu well. Incineroar slows down Rillaboom thanks to Intimidate and threatens super effective damage with Flare Blitz. Amoonguss can redirect super effective moves like Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and provide Pollen Puff healing. Ting-Lu, in return, checks Pokemon like Chi-Yu and Flutter Mane, which can be troublesome for Amoonguss.

Sand Tomb Support.description:
• Sand Tomb is able to trap in opponents so they can't escape disruption like Yawn. Ruination and Rocky Helmet act as the main damage dealing methods, with Stomping Tantrum used as its STAB move and Body Press as a consistent source of damage when Intimidated. Taunt can be used to shut down Amoonguss and other status moves.

  • The Special Defense investment allows Ting-Lu to live Moonblast from Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane. The Defense investment allows Ting-Lu to survive Wood Hammer from Rillaboom and Ivy Cudgel from a Terastallized Ogerpon-W.

  • Tera Poison is the most consistent Tera type for Ting-Lu, as it provides a resistance to Flutter Mane's Moonblast, the STAB moves of Rillaboom, and Close Combat from the Urshifu formes.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• Heavy Slam allows Ting-Lu to OHKO Flutter Mane, while Ruination and Body Press provide consistent damage. Alternatively, Throat Chop can be used as a reliable Dark-Type STAB move that can also prevent Parting Shot from Incineroar and Hyper Voice from Ursaluna-B.

  • Ting-Lu uses Assault Vest to bolster its special bulk. The EV spread allows Ting-Lu to survive 3 Moonblasts from Flutter Mane, and it also almost always lives Surging Strikes from Tera Water Urshifu-R. The Attack investment ensures an OHKO on Flutter Mane with Heavy Slam.

  • Tera Poison is the most consistent Tera type for Ting-Lu, as it provides a resistance to Flutter Mane's Moonblast, the STAB moves of Rillaboom, and Close Combat from the Urshifu formes.

Choice Item Attacker.description:
Chi-Yu is a phenomenal glass cannon; it has a strong offensive typing and good Special Attack, aided by its ability. These qualities along with proper speed control allow it to pressure common metagame Pokemon including both Calyrex formes, Rillaboom, Amoonguss, and Zamazenta-C. Snarl threatens a common Restricted core that revolves around redirection—Calyrex and Clefairy—and it can be used to chip away and weaken the damage output of bulkier specially offensive threats like Raging Bolt and Terapagos. On the other hand, Tera Blast is tailored to the Choice Scarf set, which commonly runs Tera Ground to threaten large amounts of damage to Miraidon, Raging Bolt, and Incineroar. Choice Specs allows Chi-Yu to pick up OHKOs on Pokemon like Assault Vest Rillaboom and Calyrex-I with Heat Wave and bulky Pelipper with Dark Pulse. Choice Scarf enables Chi-Yu to outspeed common fast metagame staples such as Chien-Pao, Calyrex-S, and Flutter Mane without Protosynthesis Speed activated. The defensive investment guarantees that Chi-Yu survives Surging Strikes and Tera Water Aqua Jet from Urshifu-R when Chi-Yu has used Tera Ghost, High Horsepower from most Assault Vest Rillaboom, and Tera Starstorm from Terapagos-S at +2. The Speed EVs allow Chi-Yu to outspeed maximum Speed Adamant Urshifu formes, and it also outspeeds Caylrex-S if running Choice Scarf. Special Attack EVs allow Choice Scarf Chi-Yu to threaten OHKOs on Miraidon with Tera Blast Ground and Ogerpon-H with Overheat. Tera Ghost is absolutely necessary for Choice Specs Chi-Yu because it can avoid Fake Out and Fighting-type moves like Body Press from Zamazenta-C. However, Choice Scarf Chi-Yu is often able to run Tera Ground instead for Tera Blast to pressure certain Pokemon like Miraidon and Raging Bolt.

Incineroar completely walls Chi-Yu and is able to pivot in and out with Parting Shot, while Urshifu-R is able to simply tank a hit and OHKO Chi-Yu. Kyogre and Pelipper are also definite Chi-Yu answers, as they weaken its Fire-type moves with Drizzle and can retaliate with an OHKO with Water Spout or Origin Pulse and Weather Ball, respectively. Chi-Yu has a plethora of great partners; Choice Specs Terapagos and Miraidon both take great advantage of the power boost provided by Beads of Ruin and are able to pressure Pokemon like Kyogre and Incineroar. Koraidon is another good partner for it because it sets up the sun, overriding rain from Pelipper and Kyogre and boosting Chi-Yu's Fire-type attacks. This also mitigates its weakness to Water-type moves, aiding in Chi-Yu's matchup against the aforementioned threats. Chi-Yu can also function by itself with speed control from Prankster Tailwind setters like Whimsicott and Tornadus, which can also set up the sun.

Glass Cannon.description:
Chi-Yu is an incredibly strong special attacker, and because of its ability Beads of Ruin, it's able to support other special attacking teammates while still dealing a lot of damage. It matches up well against some common restricted Pokemon such as both Calyrex formes and Zamazenta-C and it can also pressure common Pokemon such as Rillaboom, Gholdengo, and Amoonguss with its STAB moves. Snarl keeps special attacking threats such as Calyrex-S and Terapagos in check and still does respectable spread damage, while Dark Pulse provides strong and consistent damage. Overheat is an instant burst of damage that allows Chi-Yu to OHKO even bulky threats like Rillaboom and Zamazenta-C while also getting around Wide Guard. Since it is very frail, Focus Sash helps Chi-Yu survive for longer, whereas Life Orb gives it a significant damage boost, allowing it to OHKO Flutter Mane with Overheat and 2HKO Miraidon with Dark Pulse. Tera Ghost allows it to avoid Fake Out and gain an immunity to otherwise threatening Fighting-type attacks from Koraidon and the Urshifu formes.

Chi-Yu pairs well with strong special attackers such as Flutter Mane and Terapagos, since both of them benefit a lot from Beads of Ruin. Chi-Yu struggles with its average Speed stat and appreciates speed control from Tornadus, since it allows Chi-Yu to outspeed threats such as Koraidon, Miraidon, Flutter Mane, and Calyrex-S and deal respectable amount of damage with Beads of Ruin-boosted Bleakwind Storm. Chi-Yu also has problems with Urshifu-R, since it can switch-in on both Heat Wave and Dark Pulse and OHKO Chi-Yu back with Surging Strikes. Amoonguss helps with that issue, by redirecting away Fighting- and Water-type attacks from Urshifu-R, letting Chi-Yu deal damage more consistently. Pelipper is a strong Chi-Yu answer, since it sets up rain and is able to protect teammates from Chi-Yu's attacks with Wide Guard. Incineroar and Assault Vest Raging Bolt can take hits from it easily, meaning that the former can pivot out with Parting Shot and the latter is able to use Snarl, do high damage to it, or take advantage of Beads of Ruin and attack its partner.

Choice Attacker.description:
• Snarl is used as utility and a way to check special attacking compositions such as Farigiraf + Ursaluna-B. Overheat is appreciated as a single target nuke, hitting almost twice as hard as Heat Wave.

  • Choice Specs is used to give Chi-Yu maximum offensive pressure and allow it to pick up OHKOes on Amoonguss and Kingambit with Heat Wave. Alternatively, Chi-Yu can opt for Choice Scarf to outspeed threats like Landorus, Chien-Pao, and Flutter Mane.

  • The HP EVs allow for Chi-Yu to avoid the 2HKO from Flutter Mane's Moonblast and once Terastallized into the Ghost-type, almost always survive -1 Adamant Chien-Pao's Sucker Punch. The Speed EVs allow Chi-Yu to outspeed the Adamant Urshifu formes.

  • Chi-Yu prefers Tera Ghost to remove its Fighting weakness and be immune to common priority moves like Fake Out and Extreme Speed, which is crucial to preserve momentum. Although Chi-Yu can utilize Tera Fire to significantly increase its damage output, allowing Choice Scarf Chi-Yu to OHKO Ogerpon-W and Flutter Mane with Overheat and Choice Specs variants to remove Assault Vest Kingambit and Rillaboom with Heat Wave.

Roaring Moon.overview:
• Roaring Moon provides a niche as either a fast speed control option or setup sweeper thanks to the Prankster immunity provided by its Dark typing and access to Attack and Speed Booster Energy, further bolstered by its superb movepool. Roaring Moon's Dark-type STAB moves and excellent elemental resistances make it a great answer to Iron Crown and Gholdengo, as well as the Ogerpon formes.

  • Roaring Moon appreciates partners such as Ogerpon-W, Amoonguss, and Incineroar, which help it to set up Tailwind or Dragon Dance through free turns, the former two handle threats like Urshifu-R and Flutter Mane exceptionally well. Ogerpon-W greatly benefits from Tailwind, while Amoonguss has superb defensive synergy with Roaring Moon; all partners enjoy Breaking Swipe as well. With Acrobatics, Dragon Dance Roaring Moon can help the former two by removing the powder-immune Grass-types and help Incineroar by threatening both Urshfiu formes. Flutter Mane is also a great beneficiary of Roaring Moon, handling opposing Flutter Mane and both Urshifu formes with Tailwind support, and Breaking Swipe protecting it from the physical attackers it's weak to.

  • Roaring Moon's typing, while welcoming fantastic resistances, also invites weaknesses to some of the metagame's most popular threats like the aforementioned Flutter Mane, both Urshifu formes, and Chien-Pao. Roaring Moon can notably mitigate the latter two's damage output if running Breaking Swipe and break Urshifu-S and Chien-Pao's Focus Sash in the process but requires support against them. Incineroar also poses an issue for Roaring Moon, as it resists Knock Off and weakens Roaring Moon with Intimidate. Incineroar's Fake Out can also be used to stall Tailwind turns.

Dragon Dance Sweeper.description:
• Dragon Dance allows Roaring Moon to be an effective sweeper and helps reset Intimidate Attack drops, making it harder to slow down.

  • Roaring Moon utilizes Attack Booster Energy to activate Acrobatics, allowing for an OHKO on many centralizing Fighting- and Grass-types, such as the various Urshifu and Ogerpon formes, as well as Amoonguss after Terastalization.

  • After Terastalization, the bulk investment allows Roaring Moon to always survive a Tera Water-boosted Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and a Thunderclap from a Special Attack Booster Energy Raging Bolt. The Speed investment allows Roaring Moon to outspeed Adamant Urshifu formes.

  • Roaring Moon uses Tera Flying to obtain a resistance to Fighting-type moves and to gain STAB on Acrobatics.

Tailwind Support.description:
• Roaring Moon utilizes Breaking Swipe to weaken the metagame's plethora of physical attackers such as the Ogerpon formes and Rillaboom.

  • Roaring Moon uses Speed Booster Energy to outspeed the entire unboosted metagame and get off Tailwind and Breaking Swipe more consistently.

  • The HP combined with the Defense EVs allow for Roaring Moon to take Adamant Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash at -1. The Special Defense EVs allow Roaring Moon to almost always survive unboosted Flutter Mane's Dazzling Gleam, as well as a Dragon Pulse from Raging Bolt. The Speed investment lets Roaring Moon outspeed Speed Booster Energy Iron Crown, as well as Adamant Dragonite under Tailwind,

  • Roaring Moon uses Tera Poison to obtain resistances to Fairy- and Fighting-type moves it was originally weak to, which is also a great neutral typing into the metagame.

Clear Amulet.description:
Koraidon is a powerful offensive threat that can also enable its partners with sun. Koraidon's strong attacking moves and high base Attack in the sun allow it to beat many metagame staples such as Amoonguss, Rillaboom, Urshifu-R, and Terapagos. Collision Course is Koraidon's preferred STAB move thanks to a lack of drawbacks, and Flare Blitz is Koraidon's strongest move due to sun. Flame Charge will make Koraidon the fastest Pokemon on the field after its use. Clear Amulet is the item of choice to prevent stat drops from Incineroar and Icy Wind Flutter Mane. The EV spread allows Koraidon to survive an Adamant Chien-Pao Ice Spinner and Helping Hand-boosted Astral Barrage from Spell Tag Calyrex-S. Tera Fire is used to increase the power of Flare Blitz and Flame Charge while offering a resistance to Fairy- and Ice-type moves such as Moonblast and Ice Spinner from Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao, respectively.

Calyrex-I is a good check to Koraidon, since it can Terastallize into Fire or Water to resist Flare Blitz, set up Trick Room, and deal super effective damage to Koraidon both before and after its Terastallization with Glacial Lance and High Horsepower, respectively. Pelipper and Tornadus completely counter Koraidon, dealing massive damage with their Flying-type moves and being able to shut down sun with their weather control. Flutter Mane and Raging Bolt offer strong damage in the sun; Flutter Mane provides speed control with Icy Wind, and Raging Bolt offers a check to Pokemon that can change the weather like Pelipper, Tornadus, and Kyogre. Incineroar and Rillaboom are used since they have access to Fake Out, allowing Koraidon to attack freely.

Choice Specs.description:
Miraidon is able to sweep through teams thanks to its high Special Attack and Hadron Engine setting up Electric Terrain, which increases its damage output and prevents sleep such as from Amoonguss's Spore. Miraidon runs Choice Specs and Tera Electric to increase its damage output further allowing it to OHKO bulky Pokemon, such as Incineroar. Volt Switch allows Miraidon to pivot out, which, when combined with its high Speed, allows it to avoid damage trades and help it win the Terrain war against Rillaboom. Draco Meteor is run as STAB coverage, as its high base power allows it to OHKO threats like Groudon, Koraidon, and Raging Bolt. Miraidon can use Discharge to circumvent redirection, such as Amoonguss's Rage Powder or Ogerpon-W's Follow Me; however, this can force Miraidon's ally to use Protect unless it is a Ground-type. Miraidon has a strong matchup into Kyogre, as it can outspeed and threaten to OHKO it.

Miraidon is often paired with Farigiraf because it blocks Fake Out, which Miraidon cannot block and slows Miraidon down easily. Miraidon is also usually paired alongside Whimsicott for Tailwind support, which allows Miraidon to outspeed and OHKO Calyrex-S. Miraidon also struggles against foes that can maintain speed control, such as Calyrex-S in Tailwind and Calyrex-I in Trick Room, as they can outspeed Miraidon and threaten big damage. Calyrex-S often runs Focus Sash to take a hit from Miraidon, while Calyrex-I OHKOes Miraidon with Glacial Lance. It can also struggle against Groudon with redirection support, as Draco Meteor can be redirected and Precipice Blades threatens to OHKO in return. Miraidon should also carefully maintain Electric Terrain against Rillaboom in order to not have its damage output significantly reduced.

Walking Wake.overview:
• With an excellent typing and respectable stats, Walking Wake finds a place on sun teams using Protosynthesis to make up for its Speed tier while also 2HKOing most neutral targets with sun= boosted Hydro Steam and threatening common Pokemon like Incineroar and Landorus.

  • Walking Wake pairs well with Torkoal, which can set up sun and support it through moves like Helping Hand. It is commonly sighted with Ogerpon-C, which provides redirection, and Farigiraf, which blocks priority.

  • Walking Wake struggles against a common threat, Flutter Mane which threatens it with its Fairy-type STAB moves and outspeeds it. Ogerpon-W also has a good matchup, since it can redirect Hydro Steam and threaten a 2HKO on Walking Wake with Horn Leech. It also consistently needs sun up, which can be advantageous to opposing Flutter Mane and Raging Bolt, as they can then threaten an OHKO on it.

Sun Sweeper.description:
• The EV spread allows Walking Wake to survive Special Attack Booster Energy Flutter Mane's Dazzling Gleam and Adamant Miracle Seed Rillaboom's Wood Hammer. It can also pick an OHKO on Amoonguss with Life Orb-boosted Flamethrower in sun.

  • Hydro Steam and Draco Meteor are Walking Wake's main STAB moves, while Flamethrower can threaten Pokemon that resist them, like Amoonguss and Kingambit. Dragon Pulse is a more spammable STAB move thanks to lack of drawbacks. Tera Blast can provide additional coverage when utilised with Tera Steel, threatening massive damage on Fairy-types like Flutter Mane.

  • Tera Fire and Steel are preferred to gain a resistance to Flutter Mane's and Rillaboom's STAB moves. Tera Fire also resists Ogerpon-H's STAB moves and boosts Flamethrower, which can threaten huge damage combined with the sun boost. On the other hand, Tera Steel grants crucial resistances, such as against Raging Bolt's Dragon-type STAB attacks, which normally threatens Walking Wake.

Ogerpon.overview:
• Ogerpon is a strong offensive Pokemon that is unique in being able to check many top Pokemon such as Incineroar and Flutter Mane thanks to its ability Defiant and Speed-boosting Embody Aspect after Terastallization. Combined with access to Follow Me and natural immunity to Spore, Ogerpon is capable of being a constant threat while still providing good supportive value.

  • Ogerpon is almost exclusively used on teams built around Dondozo. With its ability Defiant, Ogerpon can be used to punish Incineroar and Gouging Fire, disincentivizing them from weakening both Dondozo and Chien-Pao and even picking up a clean OHKO on Incineroar with Superpower. Once Terastallized, It can outspeed and OHKO Flutter Mane and both Urshifu formes, which are difficult for Dondozo and Chien-pao or Dragonite to handle.

  • Ogerpon struggles against Pokemon that resist Grass STAB as Tornadus and Raging Bolt as well as foes that outspeed it, either forcing Ogerpon to Terastallize or be unable to attack before fainting, such as Chien-Pao, which outspeeds and can survive one hit thanks to it usually holding a Focus Sash. Ogerpon's Grass typing means it's weak to common threats such as Chien-Pao and Gouging Fire, and its middling bulk makes it unable to take more than two attacks most of the time.

Offensive Redirector.description:
• Superpower is used as coverage to hit Steel- and the plethora of Dark-types that resist Ivy Cudgel, such as Kingambit or Chi-yu. Follow Me can be used to redirect attention from the frailer Chien-Pao and Glimmora, making both exponentially harder to deal with, especially so considering Ogerpon resists Urshifu-R Surging Strike's, one of the best counters to Chien-Pao and Glimmora

  • Covert Cloak is used to prevent a flinch from Fake Out, allowing Ogerpon to pressure Incineroar and its partner turn one. Additionally, blocking certain secondary effects such as Icy Wind's Speed drops from opposing Flutter Manes is useful.

  • The Attack investment is necessary to guarantee an OHKO on Incineroar with Superpower, on Flutter Mane once Ogerpon Terastallizes, and to have the highest chance of an OHKO on Urshifu-R. The Speed investment allows Ogerpon to outspeed Choice Scarf Landorus-T after Terastallization. The rest of the EVs are used to round out Ogerpon's bulk.

Ogerpon-W is often used to redirect attacks and threaten common Fire-types such as Incineroar and Chi-Yu and Ground-types such as Ursaluna-B and Landorus with Ivy Cudgel. Ogerpon-W has excellent matchups into Urshifu-R and Kyogre, both of which struggle to deal significant damage to Ogerpon-W while it can threaten them with Horn Leech or Wood Hammer. Horn Leech is used to deal consistent damage while boosting Ogerpon-W's longevity, while Wood Hammer allows Ogerpon-W to OHKO Flutter Mane and Kyogre. Ogerpon-W also matches up well into Calyrex-S and Ursaluna-B after it Terastallizes, threatening to 2HKO Calyrex-S and OHKO Ursaluna-B with Tera Water Ivy Cudgel. The HP and Defense investment allows Ogerpon-W to survive Collision Course in sun from Koraidon, Wood Hammer from Assault Vest Rillaboom, and two High Horsepowers from Calyrex-I after Terastallizing, and it gives it a high chance of surviving two Behemoth Blades from Zacian-C. The HP and Special Defense investment allows Ogerpon-W to survive Astral Barrage from Tera Ghost Choice Specs Calyrex-S, Discharge from Choice Specs Miraidon, and, when Terastallized, Blood Moon from Ursaluna-B; Ogerpon-W also has a high chance of surviving Overheat from Chi-Yu. The Attack investment allows Ogerpon-W to 2HKO Incineroar after Intimidate, and the Speed investment allows Ogerpon-W to outrun Landorus.

Ogerpon-W's redirection makes it an ideal partner for Pokemon that want to set up freely and frail offensive threats that can be KOed easily such as Calm Mind Terapagos and Choice Specs Calyrex-S, respectively. Ogerpon-W survives attacks such as Collision Course from Koraidon and Close Combat from Urshifu-R, which threaten Terapagos, and can redirect Sucker Punch from Chien-Pao, which threatens Calyrex-S. Ogerpon-W also threatens checks to Calyrex-S such as Incineroar and Chi-Yu. Ogerpon-W struggles against Miraidon, Raging Bolt, and Rillaboom, all of which wall and threaten it. Calyrex-I threatens all of these, making it an ideal partner for Ogerpon-W. Ogerpon-W benefits Calyrex-I by threatening Incineroar and redirecting attacks, such as Knock Off and Will-O-Wisp, that hinder Calyrex-I. A partner Incineroar also pairs well with Ogerpon-W, with Incineroar's Intimidate and Ogerpon-W's Embody Aspect working in tandem to make Ogerpon-W difficult to remove. Ogerpon-W supports Incineroar by redirecting attacks that threaten Incineroar such as Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and Earth Power from Ursaluna-B.

Offensive.description:
Ogerpon-H functions as an offensive Pokemon that can support its team in a pinch with Follow Me. Wood Hammer and Grassy Glide threaten Water-types such as Urshifu-R and Pelipper, which would otherwise resist Ivy Cudgel. Ogerpon-H has a good matchup into Grass-types such as Amoonguss and Rillaboom, since it can threaten both of them with Ivy Cudgel and redirect Spore and Grass-type STAB moves from the two. Wood Hammer is used to maximize damage output, OHKOing Urshifu-R and Flutter Mane, and Grassy Glide is used for priority in Grassy Terrain. Follow Me is used to allow its partner to set up, redirect attacks in a pinch, and redirect Spore from Amoonguss

Ogerpon-H appreciates partners that can help enable its damage output. Some of the best partners for Ogerpon-H are Koraidon, Groudon, and Rillaboom. Both Koraidon and Groudon set up sun, allowing Ogerpon-H to deal massive damage with sun-boosted Ivy Cudgel. Rillaboom offers Fake Out support for Ogerpon-H, giving it free turns to set up Swords Dance and sweep. Rillaboom also sets up Grassy Terrain when it switches in, enabling priority Grassy Glide. Incineroar is Ogerpon-H's main check, as Incineroar is able to switch into all of Ogerpon-H's attacks, while also reducing its damage output with Intimidate. Dragon-types such as Koraidon and Raging Bolt are also nuisances to Ogerpon-H, since they wall it and can safely attack it or set up with Swords Dance and Calm Mind, respectively.

Offensive Redirector.description:
Ogerpon-C is an offensive redirector, keeping allies such as Miraidon and Calyrex-I safe while eliminating common foes like Ogerpon-H, Tornadus, and Chi-Yu. Ogerpon-C has an excellent matchup into Amoonguss, as it can redirect Spore. Follow Me allows Ogerpon-C to keep its partner safe. Power Whip is used to do big damage to Pokemon like Groudon and Urshifu-R while keeping Sturdy intact. Alternatively, Horn Leech can be used to sacrifice power for recovery, allowing Ogerpon-C to reactivate Sturdy, while Wood Hammer is used for a burst of damage, but it breaks Sturdy.

Ogerpon-C struggles to damage common Steel-type Pokemon such as Zamazenta-C and Gholdengo, which can set up on it or threaten to bring Ogerpon-C down to Sturdy. Due to its great ability to redirect attacks, Ogerpon-C is commonly seen on hyper offense Tailwind or Trick Room teams supporting Restricted Pokemon like Miraidon and Calyrex-I. Ogerpon-C also adds a fast mode on Trick Room teams and has great damage output while removing problematic foes like Incineroar. Ogerpon-C pairs well with Koraidon, as it can effectively remove Pelipper and Tornadus and prevent them from disrupting Koraidon's weather. Ogerpon-C can also reliably redirect Spore from Amoonguss and threaten Calyrex-I regardless of Terastallization. In return, Koraidon can remove the plethora of opposing Steel-types. Some good partners for Ogerpon-C, aside from Calyrex-I, Miraidon, and Koraidon, are Whimsicott, Tornadus, and Farigiraf. Whimsicott or Tornadus can set Tailwind for Ogerpon-C to outspeed faster Pokemon like Flutter Mane, Choice Scarf Urshifu-R, and Chi-Yu, threatening to OHKO them. Finally, Farigiraf blocks Fake Out, letting Ogerpon-C deal a lot damage; Ogerpon-C can also help Farigiraf set Trick Room thanks to Follow Me support.

Redirection Support.description:
• Ivy Cudgel synergizes well with Ogerpon-C's Grass-type moves, hitting Fire- and Flying-types like Tornadus, Incineroar, and Chi-Yu.

  • Horn Leech provides Ogerpon-C with recovery, while Power Whip hits targets harder, threatening an OHKO on Urshifu-R.

  • Follow Me lets it redirect moves away from its teammates like Sucker Punch and Spore from Chien-Pao and Amoonguss, respectively.

  • Tera Rock bolsters Ivy Cudgel's damage, letting it guarantee an OHKO on Entei, and the Defense boost thanks to Embody Aspect can let it almost always survive Close Combat from Choice Scarf Urshifu-R.

Archaludon.overview:
• Archaludon can utilize its above-average bulk, solid Special Attack stat, and great Ability in Stamina to check and OHKO threats such as Urshifu-R, Incineroar, and Raging Bolt.

  • Archaludon's access to Stamina and Body Press combined with its resistances and great physical bulk make it an amazing check to Pokemon such as Rillaboom and the Ogerpon formes and also allow it to act as a wincon.

  • Archaludon appreciates teammates like Amoonguss and Sinistcha that provide it with recovery through Pollen Puff and Hospitality, as well as Rage Powder for redirection. Rillaboom provides Fake Out support, as well as passive healing through Grassy Terrain and priority with Grassy Glide that discourages the opponent from leading with Urshifu-R. Dual screens from Grimmsnarl and damage reduction from Incineroar's Intimidate or Snarl are also useful for keeping Archaludon alive to stack Stamina or Electro Shot stat increases.

  • Archaludon fits well on rain teams thanks to its Grass and Electric resistances. It appreciates teammates such as Pelipper that can check opposing Ground- and Fighting-types like Landorus and both Urshifu formes; Pelipper's rain support also allows Electro Shot to charge in one turn, OHKOing Urshifu-R and Tornadus. Archaludon also functions well on Trick Room teams due to many of its checks being faster than it, such as both Urshifu formes, Landorus, and Chien-Pao running Sacred Sword.
